loans.name: 02130602 _ Thôn Hiệp Thành Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Loan has a retail business selling clothes and shoes. She is applying for a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes to resell. 

Loan is 43 years old and she is married with four children. Loan lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Loan is the group leader of the 02130602 _ Thôn Hiệp Thành Xã Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which consists of seven members.  In 2012, Loan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Loan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Diamba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Diamba est un marié de 31 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit chez lui  même à Bougouni dans le quartier Heremakono Nord
Ayant fréquenté l’école coranique  pendant quelques années,  il décide de s’intéresser au commerce notamment l’achat et la vente  des articles divers comme les radios, cassettes, téléphones, ceintures chaussures cirages et autres. Il mène cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans.
Dans le souci de satisfaire leur  clientèle  en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il collabore depuis 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux prêts précédents, il est à son troisième. Il compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter, 5 petits radios, 15 ceintures, 10 cassettes, 4 téléphones portables, 7 cirages. Il s’approvisionne  à Bamako et la vente se fait  essentiellement en détaille. Sa  clientèle constituée de routiers venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, Sikasso, Yanfolila et celle de la population locale. Il  espère réaliser  un bénéfice de 60.000 FCFA  par mois qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Diamba, 31 years old, is a married father of two. He lives in his own place in Bougouni, in the district of Heremakono Nord. Having attended Koranic school for a few years, he decided to become interested in commerce, especially in the buying and selling of various goods, such as radios, cassettes, telephones, belts, shoes, shoe polish, and more. He has been running this business for over five years. 

Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After having correctly paid back two previous loans, he is now on his 3rd loan. 

He intends to use his loan to purchase 5 small radios, 15 belts, 10 cassettes, 4 mobile telephones, and 7 of shoe polish. His supplies are gotten in Bamako. His sales are made essentially at the retail level. His customers are composed of truck drivers from big cities, such as Bamako, Sikasso, and Yanfolila, and of the local population.

He hopes to make a profit of 60,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to pay back the loan. The rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: 02130102 Thôn 3 Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng works in agriculture farming rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seed to grow and sell in the future.

Hồng is 52 years old and she is married with three children.

Hồng is the group leader of the 02130102 Thôn 3 Xã Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which consists of five members. Hồng lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2012, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds to grow and sell in the future

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She has been offered a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. With the loan, she will buy some additional supplies such as  fish, oils, body lotion, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, soap, shampoo, coffee, and slippers. Marcelina has been involved in her business activities since 2015. She feels so comfortable running her business, because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Marcelina independent, because she can be responsible for herself, and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish, oils, body lotion, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, soap, shampoo, coffee, and slippers

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is a hardworking mother with three children from Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old and a businesswoman who sells ready-to-wear clothing and books.

Cindy became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in order to avail herself of the insurance and credit offered. She has applied for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy more ready-to-wear clothing and books to sell. She is working to succeed so as to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing and books to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora tiene una hermana con un problema periodontal muy avanzado, necesita ortodoncia ya que su mordida hace que se desgasten mucho sus dientes. Ella quiere ayudarla a pagar el tratamiento para que el problema no avance, sin embargo sus recursos económicos no son muchos ya que trabaja como intendente y es el principal sostén de su hogar.
texts.en:
This woman has a sister who suffers from advanced periodontal disease. She will also need braces since her bite is causing severe wear on her teeth.

The borrower wants to pay for her sister’s treatment so that the problem does not get worse. However, she has very limited financial resources since she works as a supervisor and is the main breadwinner in her household.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's dental treatment.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 64-years-old and married with four children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

For the past 15 years,Rosenda has been a farmer. She earns 1,500 PHP each month and a member of PMPC since 2008. 

Rosenda is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat) used for oil production

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 57-year-old woman, who is married to a farmer. She has engaged in home services, doing manicures and pedicures. She has a monthly income of 2,500 PHP from doing this job. She is able to help her husband support the expenses of their eight children.  

Esther joined Paglaum last year, and has been able to take advantage of the credit services, insurances, and other benefits of the cooperative, because of her good standing in terms of loan obligations. Esther has taken a loan from Paglaum, which she will use to buy cement, sand, and gravel for finishing her house.  She is thankful to Paglaum, because she can slowly create a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to finish her house

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila owns a sari-sari store business in Plaridel. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her store. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to buy variety of commodities. She is adding an extension store in a nearby barangay, and she wishes to earn more doing this type of business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities so as to make a profit to open another store

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina, a widow, is from Oroquieta. She has a small coconut farm and also engages in making copra (dried coconut meat used to extract coconut oil), for which she buys whole coconuts.

Antonina has signed up for membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra and to pay for the construction materials to build a coconut dryer. 

Antonina hopes to succeed in this business in order to continue providing for her needs and help support her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts for making copra and to pay for construction materials to build a coconut dryer. This will help support her grandchildren

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is from Tudela. She has a farming business, growing coconut. Recently, Mila took out a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer. Mila deeply wishes to save enough for her childrens' education.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $1.000 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She is married and she opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own capital. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like sugar, salt, milk, water, oils, body lotion, coffee, slippers and shampoo.She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.Maria is living in a town with her family. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, milk, water, oils, body lotion, coffee, slippers and shampoo to make enough profit to open a bigger store

loans.name: Veronica Karina

texts.en: Veronica is 31 years old. She has been married for 10 years and has three children. She is the oldest of three brothers and she says that she likes to spend as much time as possible with her family. She is asking for a loan to buy a grocery store that was started more than 15 years ago by her parents. Veronica Karina and her husband have some savings but need the loan to complete the purchase price. Her goal is to grow the business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: To complete the purchase of a grocery store.

loans.name: Fabia

texts.en:
Fabia, a responsible mother, is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. 

Fabia wants to buy more assorted goods for her store. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money, and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more assorted goods for her store

loans.name: 030917030004.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu has a retail business selling cattle feed. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed to resell.

Thu is 50 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thu is the group leader of the 030917030004.thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2009, Thu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Thu has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle feed to resell

loans.name: Jackiely

texts.en:
In 2011, Jackiely learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She started a business focusing on raising hogs. 

Jackiely feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative, for trusting her with the money she used as capital. She has taken another loan to build a concrete pig pens. Jackiely always looks for better business opportunities, and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: build concrete pig pens

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is a married woman, who has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Heide is 36 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Heide has a buy-and-sell-coconut-wine business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Heide has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Tahiriniaina

texts.fr:
Tahiriniaina est une jeune femme mariée de 28 ans. Le couple élève ses 2 enfants de 2 et 8 ans dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe. Elle s’est lancée très jeune, à l’âge de 18 ans dans la vie active pour fonder son foyer et prendre son indépendance. Cette jeune femme courageuse  a commencé en vendant quelques articles de bazar (piles, batteries, stylos…), elle a aujourd’hui considérablement augmenté son stock de marchandises pour proposer aux clients un choix toujours plus divers d’articles et d’accessoires. Elle est vendeuse ambulante mais a également un stand au grand marché de la ville 2 jours par semaine.

Cela fait maintenant 2 ans qu’elle est partenaire de Vahatra. Elle a  également pu bénéficier, à sa demande,  des services du volet social de l’organisation (accompagnement familial à domicile et atelier éveil pour elle et son plus jeune enfant). Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte renouveler son stock de marchandises et acheter notamment une dizaine de radios,  de lecteurs MP3, de hauts parleurs et quelques autres articles comme des cartes SD etc…

Grâce aux bénéfices de son activité, Tahiriniaina a pu améliorer son quotidien en achetant des équipements pour la famille. Elle a pu acquérir un vélo et aménager son salon en achetant un canapé et des fauteuils. Cette mère de famille responsable pense également à l’éducation de ses enfants et commence à constituer une petite épargne pour sécuriser autant que possible leur avenir.
texts.en:
Tahiriniaina, 28 years old, is a young married woman. The couple are raising their two children, aged 2 and 8, in Commune Urbaine d’Antsirabe. She got started very young in an active life, at the age of 18, to start a home and become independent. This courageous young woman began selling a few bazaar items (batteries, pens, …). Today, she has increased her stock of merchandise considerably to offer her customers an evermore diverse choice of items and accessories. She is an itinerant vendor but also has a stand at the big market in town twice a week. 

For two years now, she has been a Vahatra partner. She was also able to benefit from the microfinance institution’s social services (home attendants and awareness workshop for her and her youngest child). With this new loan, she plans on renewing her stock of merchandise and purchasing in particular a dozen radios, MP3 players, loud speakers, and a few other items, such as SD cards, etc. 

Thanks to the profits from her business, Tahiriniaina has been able to improve her day-to-day life by purchasing items for the family. She was able to acquire a bicycle and to fix up her living room with a sofa and arm chairs. This committed mother also thinks about her children’s education and is beginning to build up a small savings account for securing as much as possible their future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of supplies, such as radios and enclosures

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina engages in a food vending business.  She sells homemade meals like pansit (noodles), stewed vegetables and snack food like rice cake (bibingka).   She is a 47-year-old widow woman with four children. Her youngest child is 17 years old and still attending school.

She is asking to buy supplies like rice, vegetables, meat and seasonings.  These are very essential tools that would augment Avelina's earnings. She could now cater to the orders of her customers and be able to handle her finances. With this, she could now provide her children with healthy meals and continue to send her child to school.

She is very grateful for the loan she availed; she is determined to handle it properly to be sustainable.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, vegetables, meat and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mutton and beef

loans.name: Garba

texts.fr: Garba un homme de 43ans est boucher de profession. En 2000 il a démarré son activité dans lequel il se fait aider par 01e personne. Afin d'acheter de la viande de moutons et de bœufs pour revendre, il fait un troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises.Il espère réinvestir dans l'activité et élargir les ventes sur d'autres marchés. Il a un enfant de 12ans qui est scolarisé.
texts.en: Garba is a 43-year-old man and a butcher by trade. In 2000, he started his business, where he has one person helping him. To purchase some mutton and beef to resell, he is taking out a third WAGES loan to purchase some. He hopes to reinvest in his business and expand his sales in other markets. He has a 12-year-old child, who is in school.

loans.use: to purchase mutton and beef

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 55 years of age and a resident of Liloy, Philippines. She is married with five children. Her family has a little fishing business from which to earn a living. With their business, they meet many challenges, but they realize that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Luzminda and her husband work hard selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 5,000 loan to pay for more stock of fish to resell. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of fish to resell

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

Caridad requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish and other materials for her business.

Caridad has been in this business for 12 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Margeie Luz

texts.en:
Margeie Luz is a married woman, who has five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Margeie Luz is 43 years old, and she has two children who are still in school.

She has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. Margeie Luz has requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more fish and materials for her business.

Margeie Luz has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and materials for her business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 30 years old and has three children. She has one child who is in school.

Joan is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for three years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, Joan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a married woman and has five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosie is 30 years old, and has four children who are currently in school.

Rosie has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more boxes of fish and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 14 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 56-year-old married woman, with three children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy items to sell, such as eggs, canned goods, condiments, personal care products, and other groceries.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as eggs, canned goods, condiments, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 29-year-old married woman, with five children, three of whom are in school. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 8,000 PFP through NWTF, to buy items to sell, such as eggs, canned goods, condiments, personal care products, and other groceries.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as eggs, canned goods, condiments, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Fifty-seven-year-old Ma. Dolores engages in a food-vending business. She sells halo-halo (a popular Filipino dessert, which is a mixture of shaved ice and evaporated milk, to which various boiled sweet beans, jello and fruits are added). She is a married woman with two grown children, from Loon, Bohol. In addition to her halo-halo activity, she also sells snack foods like hot cakes, to the locals in her place.

Ma. Dolores has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP. She will use this amount to buy supplies like flour, cooking oil and sugar. With this loan, Ma. Dolores could now purchase more supplies to produce hot cakes. She could now be able to continue to improve her business and handle her finances. She could now set aside some savings for future use.

Ma. Dolores dreams of expanding her business, to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvie is 33 years old and five of her children are still in school.

Elvie has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and purchase other materials for her business.

Elvie has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and purchase other materials for her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Letecia is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy items to sell, such as clothes, etc. for her business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities with her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as clothes, etc.

loans.name: Ravao

texts.fr:
Ravao a aujourd’hui 60 ans. Elle  a élevé 6 enfants avec son mari qui a, depuis quelques années, quitté le domicile conjugal. Ses 4 filles sont autonomes et toutes mariées. Il lui reste 2 garçons encore à sa charge. Cette femme courageuse tient une épicerie depuis de nombreuses années devant son domicile près du grand marché de la ville sur les hauts plateaux de Madagascar.
Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis maintenant 6 ans. Grâce aux différents prêts qu’elle a obtenus, elle a pu largement diversifier sa gamme de produits destinés à la vente et proposer également à sa clientèle une petite gargote composée de quelques plats préparés (plats malgaches, salades de pates, sandwichs, beignets). Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte notamment acheter 100 kg de café, 100 kg de riz, 10 cartons de savon et quelques autres produits divers (huile, eau, sucre, lessive) pour réapprovisionner son stock de marchandises.

Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle a réussi à acheter un bœuf dont des membres de sa famille s’occupe à la campagne. Elle a également commencé à épargner pour pouvoir un jour construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Ravao, 60 years old at this time, has raised six children with her husband, who abandoned his wife at home a few years ago. Her four daughters are autonomous and married. Two sons remain in her care. This courageous woman has had a grocery store for a number of years in front of her home near the town’s big market, on the high plateaus of Madagascar. 

She has been a Vahatra partner for six years now. Thanks to the different loans she has obtained, she was able largely to diversify her range of products for sale and to offer as well to her customers a few cooked dishes (Malagascar-style food, pasta salads, sandwiches, beignets).

With this new loan, she plans in particular on purchasing 100 kg of coffee, 100 kg of rice, 10 boxes of soap, and a few other products (oil, water, sugar, laundry soap) to resupply her inventory. 

With the profits from her business, she has succeeded in purchasing a head of cattle, which members of her family take care of, in the countryside. She has also begun saving money for building her own house one day.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of grocery items, such as coffee and flour

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes engages in a food-vending business. She sells chicken barbecue to the locals in her community. She is a married woman with six children, from Talibon, Bohol. She is 43 years old. Her oldest child is 22, and the youngest is 7 years old.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like chicken, seasonings and vegetables. These ingredients will be used in making more barbecue to sell. In this way, her income will improve and she will be able to handle her finances. She could now provide her family with good food and be able to continue sending her children to school.

Ediltrudes would like to expand her business, for the improvement of the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies like chicken, seasonings and vegetables.

loans.name: Meludgen

texts.en:
Meludgen is 38 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, and the like.

Meludgen has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income from selling vegetables. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Meludgen aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and chips.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marie is 30 years old, and she has one child in school.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy materials she needs, like spare parts, etcetera.

Marie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other maintenance, for her business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Antonieta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruit and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Antonieta is borrowing 40,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Antonieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Helen

texts.es: HELEN: Es originaria de Waspam-Rio Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita, tiene 37 años de edad, casada con un hijo de 18 años que estudia su primer año de carrera universitaria. Trabaja como docente de escuela de educación primaria. Con el propósito de construir su vivienda de tambo y madera solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, clavos, zinc, postes de madera y cubrir costos de transporte y mano de obra. Ella sueña con dedicarse a la comercialización de frijoles para contar con otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Helen is originally from Waspam-Rio Coco and is of Miskito ethnicity. She is 37 years old, married, and has an 18-year-old son who is in his first year of study toward a university degree. Helen works as a teacher at a primary school.

With the intention of building a wooden stilt house, Helen is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials such as lumber, nails, zinc sheets, wooden posts, as well as cover transportation and labor costs. She dreams of selling beans in order to have another source of income.

loans.use: to pay for materials, transportation costs, and labor in order to build a wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron in order to build a kitchen in her home.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Jovy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Wilma

Wilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more inventory of household goods to sell. She has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and she earns additional income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old and married; she has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, now.

Rosemarie has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell at her store, like eggs, canned goods, condiments, personal care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like eggs, canned goods, condiments, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr:
Jean Claude est un homme de 52 ans originaire de la campagne. Aujourd’hui, il vit dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe avec sa femme. Le couple a élevé 4 enfants : une fille de 13 ans et un garçon de 11 ans vivent encore au sein du foyer. Une nièce de 21 ans, orpheline, a également été accueillie par le couple il y a quelques années. Jean Claude, aidé par sa femme, exerce une activité de vente/livraison de légumes. Le couple a une sérieuse connaissance et une solide expérience de l’activité puisque cela fait 27 ans qu’il travaille dans ce secteur.  Actuellement, Jean Claude livre sa marchandise jusqu’à Tamatave (grande ville portuaire de l’est de l’île, à une journée de transport d’Antsirabe) où les légumes poussent mal  et donc, où la demande est forte et le marché plus intéressant.
Jean Claude est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 4 ans. Avec ce prêt, il compte notamment acheter une tonne de carottes, une tonne de pommes de terre, une tonne de choux… et ainsi augmenter toujours le capital de son activité.
Depuis toutes ces années, les bénéfices de son activité lui ont déjà permis d’acheter son propre camion pour les livraisons alors qu’auparavant il devait prévoir la location du véhicule dans le budget de son activité. Il a également réussi à  construire une petite maison familiale. Son objectif actuel est de continuer à garantir l’éducation la meilleure possible pour ses 2 enfants restant à charge et de sécuriser autant que possible leur avenir.
texts.en:
Jean Claude is a 52-year-old man originally from the countryside. Today, he lives in Commune Urbaine d’Antsirabe with his wife. The couple are raising four children: a girl aged 13 and a boy aged 11 still living at home. An orphaned niece aged 21 has also been fostered by the couple for a few years. 

Jean Claude is helped by his wife in operating a business selling/delivering vegetables. The couple are seriously knowledgeable and have solid experience in this business for having worked for 27 years in this sector. Currently, Jean Claude delivers his goods as far as Tamatave (a large port city on the island’s east side and a day’s travel from Antsirabe). There, vegetables do not grow well, so there is a strong demand, and the market is more advantageous. 

Jean Claude has been a Vahatra partner for four years. With this loan, he intends in particular to purchase a tonne of carrots, a tonne of potatoes, and a tonne of cabbage… thus increasing his capital even more for his business. 

For all these years, his business profits have already enable him to purchase his own truck for making deliveries when in the past he had to plan for renting the vehicle in his business budget. He has also succeeded in building a small family house. His goal is currently to continue to guarantee the best possible education for his two children still in his care and to secure their future as much as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of vegetables, such as carrots and potatoes

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory wants you to know that her previous loan helped her improve her profit from her business. She has also increased her fund used for her food stall business, and the loan helped support their daily needs and expenses.

She aspires to increase her income and add more foods to what she usually cooks and sells. She needs an additional PHP 25,000 to buy more ingredients and supplies in order to make this happen. She looks forward to seeing their lives progress someday as she improves her business.

Lory hopes to give her children a better-quality education. She desires to start up and operate another business in which she wishes also to excel. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:

Virginia has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Virginia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Nimfa dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: ADELA: Es una señora amable, es originaria de la comunidad Bilwaskarma, que se localiza a 12 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco. Ella pertenece a la etnia Mayagna, tiene 50 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos que estudian su secundaria y carrera universitaria. Trabaja como enfermera. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado la compra de materiales de construcción para tener su propia vivienda de tambo y madera, sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda. Es por eso que solicita financiamiento para terminar de comprar los materiales e iniciar la construcción de su vivienda, pagar mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adela is a friendly woman, originally from the community of Bilwaskarma, which is located 12 kilometers from the Waspam-Rio Coco municipality. She belongs to the Mayagna ethnic group, she is 50 years old, married with 3 children who are in high school and university. She works as a nurse. 

With a lot of effort, little by little she has begun to buy construction materials to build her own wooden stilt home.  However, with her salary she does not have enough to start constructing her home. That's why she is asking for financing to finish buying the materials and to start constructing her home, also to pay for labor costs. 

She dreams of having a beautiful house with better security and a better environment for her children.

loans.use: to start construction on her house

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang, born in 1995, is a Thai ethnic minority woman. She is currently living with her husband and her two children (one son and one daughter) in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding. Her family has one hectare of cultivating land for coffee, and each year the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover their living expenses and save a small amount. She wants to invest in the coffee field, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the coming season of coffee cultivation.

She hopes that the loan will help her family have money to take good care of the coffee field, and that the next crop from the coffee field will bring her family a yield that is twice as much as last year's. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase piglets and some feed

loans.name: Cristy

Cristy dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to provide and secure the future of her family.

She supplements this income with earnings from her rice farming. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Teresita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other veterinary supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, personal care products and other groceries.

Veronica has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy any cosmetics and materials for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy any cosmetics and materials for her business

loans.name: Camila Alejandra

texts.es: Camila es una joven de 24 años de edad con gran iniciativa para los negocios, desde muy joven trabajó en una cadena de almacenes de donde decidió retirarse e independizarse, con su liquidación compro vitrinas mostradoras, enseres y  artículos de papelería, accesorios, esmaltes para uñas y demás.  Hoy en día el almacén misceláneo de Camila cuenta con seis años de experiencia y una clientela consolidada, diariamente los vecinos y transeúntes del barrio donde reside en el municipio de Soledad, pueden realizar sus compras en los horarios de 8:30 a.m. a 8:30 p.m., a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago en sus compras o pago de contado. La gama de productos se ha incrementado en la medida que sus clientes le han solicitado nuevos artículos como ropa interior, toallas, cremas corporales y colonias, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para cumplir con pedidos de sus clientes como colonias, cremas, ropa interior y útiles escolares. Pese a los desafíos que se le han presentado como el insuficiente capital para invertir, Camila no ha perdido la batalla porque su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio hasta lograr abrir otra sucursal y continuar ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Camila is a young 24 year old woman with a great initiative for business. Since very young ,she worked for a department store chain from which she decided to leave and become independent. With her final payoff she bought display counters, furniture, and paper supplies, accessories, nail polish and others. Today, Camila's miscellaneous shop has been around for six years and it has a established clientele. Daily, the neighbors and passers-by in the neighborhood where she lives in the municipality of Soledad, can do their shopping between 8:30 a.m. and 8:30 p.m. She offers them payment terms on their purchases or cash. The range of products has increased to the extent that her clients request new products such as underwear, towels, body creams and colognes. Currently, she is applying to a credikiva loan, this is the first request she is making to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to fulfill her clients orders such as colognes, creams, underwear, and school supplies. In spite of the challenges she faces such as insufficient capital to invest, Camila has not lost the battle because her goal is to continue growing with her business so that she can open another store and can continue helping her family.

loans.use: To fulfill her clients orders such as colognes, creams, underwear and school supplies.

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Sharon Rose is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Sharon Rose dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Eleuresa

texts.en:
Eleuresa engages in selling accessories. She sells accessories like bracelets, fashion earrings, and many others.  She is 60 years old and a married woman with seven grown children from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband earns a living by being a security guard. 

She  is asking for a loan to to purchase assorted accessories to sell. These will enable Eleuresa to have a variety of accessories to sell to her respective customers. Thus, it will cause her to augment her income and be able to settle her finances. She could now be able to do some business expansion that would help improve her livelihood.

She is hoping that someday, she could have a more successful business to handle to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase assorted accessories to sell

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hong, born in 1988, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family includes three members: her, her husband and her lovely daughter. They are now living in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family's living is mainly based on animal breeding and cultivation. Her family has about 8,000 square meters of cultivated land for coffee. They are also feeding geese and chickens to get additional food for the family. 

Each year, after the coffee harvest, the income is just enough to cover the food for the whole family and save a small amount of money. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coffee, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the next crop of coffee.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the coffee, with a high yield that is half of the last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the next crop of coffee

loans.name: Bientama Group

texts.fr: Karidjatou, membre représentatif est mariée est mère de 3 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. Cette brave dame fait le jus de bissap pour vendre. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter du bissap, 3 sacs de sucre de 50 kg chacun a raison de 14 000 francs le sac soit 42 000 francs, 20 assiettée de bissap à 15 000 francs et les autres ingrédients nécessaires(arôme, menthe,...) pour faire du jus pour vendre. Présentement au Burkina il fait très chaud donc le moment est propice pour vendre du jus. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra d'augmenter le volume de son activité et aussi de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Karidjatou is the group representative.  She is married and mother to three children, two of whom attend school.  This wonderful woman makes hibiscus juice to sell.  

She will use her loan to buy three 50 kgs sacks of sugar (for 14,000 francs CFA a sack), twenty quantities of hibiscus flowers (for 15,000 francs CFA) and other ingredients needed to make juice (flavourings, mint, etc).

Currently it is very hot in Burkina Faso so it is the ideal moment to be selling hibiscus juice.  Karidjatou's earnings will enable her to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy hibiscus flowers, sugar and other necessary ingredients to make juice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale, and make bed sheets and pillows for sale.

loans.name: Nirihasina

texts.fr:
NIrihasina est une jeune femme de 25 ans qui vit dans une petite commune rurale sur les hauts plateaux de Madagascar. Elle est mariée et élève  2 enfants encore en bas âge. Cela fait 3 ans qu’elle vend divers articles et accessoires de bazar (lampes, piles, batteries, calculatrices, radios…)
Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 2 ans. Elle compte avec ce prêt renouveler son stock de marchandises mais également  acquérir plusieurs radios avec lecteur de carte SD intégré, nouveau produit récemment apparu sur le marché. 
Cette jeune mère de famille se fixe comme objectif de consolider son capital pour étendre encore son activité. Elle espère un jour pouvoir devenir grossiste. Parallèlement à cela, elle  a déjà commencé à épargner pour pouvoir construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Nirihasina is a young 25-year-old woman who lives in a small rural town in the highlands of Madagascar. She is married with two infant children. For the past three years she has been selling various articles and bazaar items (flashlights, batteries, calculators, radios, ...)

She has been a partner of Vahatra for two years. She is counting on this loan to renew her stock of goods but also to acquire several radios with built-in SD card readers, recently appeared on the market.

This young housewife's objective is to consolidate her working capital to further expand her business. She hopes one day to become a wholesaler. In addition she has already started to save to build her own house.

loans.use: buy a stock of flashlights, radios, loudspeakers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for building work on his home.

loans.name: Arlailene

texts.en:
Arlailene is 35 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Arlailene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlailene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal products, beverages and other groceries.

Arlailene has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Arlailene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal products, beverages and other groceries

loans.name: Jean Marc

texts.fr: Jean Marc, âgé de 26 ans, est marié et père deux enfants. C'est un jeune homme dynamique qui gagne sa vie en vendant des produits alimentaires au marché de son quartier. Son dévouement attire un bon nombre de clients, et il a besoin du microcrédit pour acheter suffisamment de marchandises pour satisfaire leur demande. Jean Marc veut s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie et mieux répondre aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Marc is 26 years old, married and father to two children.  He is a dynamic young man who earns a living selling foodstuffs at his local market.  His hard work attracts a lot of customers, and he has requested this loan to respond to the demand.

Jean Marc would like to improve his standard of living and provide more for the day-to-day needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and peas for resale.

loans.name: Eliane

texts.fr:
Eliane est une jeune femme de 27 ans qui vit à la campagne avec son mari et ses 2 enfants. Elle a dû, très jeune, prendre ses responsabilités et se lancer dans la vie active pour assurer les besoins fondamentaux de son foyer. En effet, dès sa majorité (18 ans) elle a démarré un petit élevage de cochons. Actuellement, elle a pu diversifier ses activités et fait de l’élevage porcin, de l’élevage bovin ainsi que du commerce de poissons.
Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 3 ans et compte avec ce nouveau prêt acheter de nouvelles têtes pour son cheptel. Elle prévoit l’acquisition d’un zébu, de 2 cochons ainsi que l’achat de 34 kilos de poissons.
Grâce aux bénéfices de son activité, elle est en train de construire sa propre maison. Les fondations et les murs étant déjà posés, il reste maintenant à terminer les finitions pour que sa maison soit réellement habitable. Eliane espère ainsi réussir à améliorer significativement la qualité de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Eliane is a young 27-year-old woman who lives in the country with her husband and two children. At a very young age she had to take responsibility and engage in a working life to ensure her household's basic needs.

Indeed, at her majority (18 years) she started a small pig farm. Currently, she has been able to diversify her activities to pig farming, cattle breeding and trading fish.

She has been a partner of Vahatra for three years and is counting on this new loan to buy additional livestock. She foresees buying a zebu, two pigs and 34 kilos of fish.

Thanks to profits from her business, she is now building her own house. The foundation and walls are already installed, and only the finishing touches must be completed to make the house actually livable.

Eliane hopes to succeed in significantly improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy one cattle and two pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a craft business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy material to be used in her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now, she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Lorna has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to be used in her business

loans.name: Mimose

texts.en:
Mimose is 46 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Bon Repos.  She earns her living selling food products and has a good level of experience in her business.

Mimose has requested this loan to increase her stock levels and generate more profit to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy eggplants and carrots for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Elana

texts.fr: Elana 36 ans, vit en union libre. Elle est mère de trois enfants. Elle a  une petite activité de revente de produits alimentaires depuis cinq ans située juste à coté de sa maison. Voulant développer son activité pour en gagner plus de revenus, elle fait une demande de crédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Elana is 36 years old and lives in civil union. She is the mother of 3 children. She has had a small business reselling food products from a location next to her home for 5 years. She has requested this loan to increase her inventory because she wants to develop her business and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy some bags of beans.

loans.name: Charité

texts.fr: Charité, âgée de 62 ans, est veuve et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre sont indépendants. Elle vend des articles de couture au marché de Bon repos. Son petit commerce, aussi peu rentable qu’il soit, ne diminue pas son dévouement à faire fonctionner davantage son activité. Charité a déjà bénéficié de prêts qui l'ont aidé à garder en vie son commerce. Elle souhaite agrandir davantage son activité et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Voulant éviter que son stock soit insuffisant, elle a demandé un microcrédit pour augmenter ses marchandises
texts.en: Charité, who is 62 years old, is a widow and the mother of 5 independent children. She sells sewing materials at the Bon Repos market. Even though her small business is not very profitable, this does not diminish her commitment to making it work better. Charité has already benefited from loans which have helped her keep her business alive. She wants to grow her business further and to improve her living conditions. She has requested this loan to increase her merchandise in order to avoid having stock shortages.

loans.use: to buy boxes of sewing thread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fruits

loans.name: Roseline

texts.fr: Roseline a 42 ans. Elle est divorcée et élève seule son enfant. Son activité consiste à acheter des tissus pour confectionner des vêtements et les revendre sur le marché. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 17 ans, c’est une couturière très connue dans son quartier. Elle cherche du crédit pour développer son activité.
texts.en: Roseline is 42 years old. She is divorced and raising her child on her own. Her business consists of buying fabric, making clothes and selling them at the market. She has been doing this for 17 years and is a noted seamstress in her area. She is requesting a loan to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of new fabric.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda esta casada su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, Fernanda tiene 32 años de edad, Fernanda tiene 3 hijas de las edades de 5 años, 10 años y 9 meses, los mayores asisten a la escuela. Fernanda se dedica a la crianza de ganado, el dinero del credito lo necesita para comprar terneros  ya que comenta que los comprar pequeños y despues de cuidarlos crecen y ya los vende obteniendo alguna ganancia, Fernanda tiene la aspracion de seguir trabajando duro para mejorar sus ingresos y sus mejorar la calidad de vida de los clientes y de familia.
texts.en:
Fernanda is married; her husband is a farmer. Fernanda is 32 years old and has three daughters, ages ten years, five years, and nine months; the two eldest are in school. 

Fernanda makes a living raising cattle. She needs this loan in order to buy calves. She says that she buys them young and then looks after them as they grow. She can then sell them in order earn a profit.

Fernanda aspires to continue working hard in order to increase her income and improve her family’s and her customers’ quality of life.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Hengel

texts.es: Hengel se dedica a la fabricación de congelados en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indiaas; Comprar insumos en mayor volumen, adecuar su local y comprar nuevas herramientas, son sus prioridades, para lograr que su negocio tenga éxito, por eso ha a acudido a un credikiva, primer finanaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual hará esta inversión y superará el deficiente capital con el que cuenta para invertir. Cuando Hengel inició su negocio lo hizo hace 2 años en compañia de su hermano, quien hoy es su gran apoyo en el negocio y con el esfuerzo conjunto generan mayores ingresos para sus familias. Su mayor deseo es incrementar sus ventas y están muy concentrados en hacerlo, trabajando de manera consistente y con mucho esmero y unidad.
texts.en:
Hengel makes a living producing frozen foods in the city of Cartagena de Indias. His priorities for this business are to buy supplies in bulk, to set up his premises, and to buy new equipment so that his business is successful. He has therefore applied for a Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to invest in his business and overcome his need for capital.

Hengel started his business two years ago with his brother – today his greatest support at the business. Together the brothers wanted to earn a higher income for their families.

Hengel’s biggest wish is to increase sales and he and his brother are working hard for this. The brothers are working together and are very dedicated.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk, to set up his premises, and to buy new equipment.

loans.name: Bénéwendé Djantoli Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Bénéwendé Djantoli est formé de 2 femmes battantes qui font le commerce. Ce groupe est à son troisième contrat de prêt et jusque là, les remboursements se font bien. Ajaratou, responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés.Cette brave dame fait des gâteaux et du jus de bissap pour vendre.Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter 1 sac de farine de blé à 20 000 francs, 1 bidon d'huile à 13 000 francs et les autres ingrédients nécessaire pour faire des gâteaux pour vendre. En plus de cela, elle va acheter, 1 sac de sucre à 20 000 francs, du bissap, de la menthe pour faire du bissap pour vendre. Après les ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra d'aider son époux a gérer les dépense de leur maison et de faire les petites dépenses de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Benewende Djantoli group consists of two dynamic women who are merchants. This group is on its third loan agreement and up till now reimbursements are correctly done. Group leader Ajaratou is married with four children, all attending (or having attended) school.

This fine lady bakes cakes and makes hibiscus juice for sale. She needs this loan to buy one bag of wheat flour at 20,000 francs, one can of culinary oil at 13,000 francs, and other ingredients needed to bake cakes for sale. On top of that, she will buy 1 sack of sugar at 20,000 francs, hibiscus and mint to make bissap (hibiscus-based drink) for sale.

After sales, her profits will enable her to help her husband manage household expenses and deal with her children's minor expenditures.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, sugar, other ingredients to make cakes for sale

loans.name: Prudence Group

texts.fr: Le groupe prudence vient de solder son deuxième prêt avec kiva. Christine, responsable du groupe remercie kiva et tous les prêteurs car le prêt lui a été bénéfique. Elle a pu continuer son activité et s'occuper de sa famille. Christine a pu solder la scolarité de ses enfants avec son épargne. Elle a besoin d'un nouveau crédit pour faire la restauration et aussi d’acheter 3 sacs de maïs à 42 000 francs stocker pour revendre au moment où le coût sera élevé. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité et de faire ses propres petites dépenses.
texts.en:
The Prudence group has just settled its second loan with Kiva. Group leader Christine thanks Kiva and all lenders because the loan was beneficial to her.

She was able to continue her business and take care of her family, and Christine was able to settle her children's tuition fees with her savings.

She needs a new loan for her catering activity and also to buy three bags of maize at 42,000 francs, to store and resell when costs are high.

After sales, her profit will enable her to pursue her business and to deal with her own minor expenses.

loans.use: make food preparations and stock maize for sale

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a farmer and sells rice to the local community. She is a 34-year-old married woman who has a passion for selling and working for her family. She earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Hazel is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has received several previous loans. She maintains her membership in good standing. She will use the loan to purchase rice to sell, which will increase her inventory and sales. Hazel continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice.

loans.name: Annonce

texts.fr: Annonce est âgé de 49 ans. Il est marié et a quatre enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et les enfants dans la maison familiale. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assumer la responsabilité du foyer, il a mis sur pied un cybercafé où il offre des services en navigation internet, traitement de texte et impressions, photocopies. Il a fait une demande de prêt qu’il compte investir dans l’achat d’une petite génératrice pour contrecarrer les problèmes d’énergie auxquels il fait face.
texts.en: Annonce is 49 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He lives with his wife and children in the family home. In order to be able to meet his needs and take on the responsibility for the household, he has opened a cyber café where he offers web browsing, word processing, printing and photocopying services. He has requested a loan which he plans to use to buy a small generator to overcome the energy problems he faces.

loans.use: to buy a small generator.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking female entrepreneur with two children. She runs a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Rowena dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to provide for and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 63 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Fortunata runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 9,500 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Fortunata has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Fortunata would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Philocia

texts.fr: Philocia, 42 ans, est divorcée. Elle a un enfant à sa charge. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques et des lessives pour trouver de quoi répondre à ses besoins et prendre soin de son enfant. Elle a recours au microcrédit, cela lui permet d’éviter des ruptures de stock.
texts.en: Philocia is 42 years old and divorced. She is raising one child. She sells beauty products and detergents so that she can earn enough to meet her needs and take care of her child. She is taking out a microloan in order to avoid stock shortages.

loans.use: to buy boxes of toilet paper.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, born in 1981, is a Kinh ethnic woman. She is married and has a daughter. They are now living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation. The married couple’s asset is about 1 hectare of cultivated land for vegetables. Though gardening is very hard, the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount. She wants to invest in gardening by buying fertilizer for planting clean and fresh vegetables to provide to the market, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy organic fertilizer for vegetables.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her invest effectively in vegetables with high productivity, so next year her family will provide tens of tons of fresh and clean vegetables to make a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Micheline, 28 ans, vit en union libre. Elle habite avec son conjoint et leur fils dans la ville de Bon Repos. Avec son mari, elle ouvert une petite épicerie en son domicile. Elle n’y met pas que des produits alimentaires. Micheline vend aussi des articles pour écoliers : stylos, crayons, cahier, etc. Elle a souvent recours au microcrédit pour éviter des ruptures de stock. Elle a déjà reçu plusieurs prêts qu’elle a utilisés à bon escient dans son activité. Sa denier demande de crédit vise à augmenter davantage son étale pour répondre aux besoins de plus de clients.
texts.en: Micheline is 28 years old and lives in common-law marriage. She lives with her spouse and their son in the town of Bon Repos. She and her common-law husband opened a grocery shop in their home. They do not only sell food products. Micheline also sells school supplies; pens, crayon and school books etc. She often takes out microloans in order to avoid stock shortages. She has already received several loans which she has put to good use for her business. She is requesting this loan with the aim of increasing her range of goods further so that she can better respond to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cooking oil.

loans.name: Jhia Mae

texts.en:
Jhia Mae is 32 years old and married with one child. Jhia Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Jhia Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, junk foods and other groceries.

Jhia Mae has been in this business for 8 years now. 

In the future, Jhia Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, junk foods and other groceries

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan, 53-years-old, joined the program of M7-MFI in January 2010. She currently lives with her husband, her two sons and her daughter-in-law in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is mainly based on her civil servant meager salary, so it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and to be able to save a small amount.  

She wants to buy corn seeds and fertilizer for the coming corn season, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.
	
She expects the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the cultivation, and in the next crop, it will bring her family an abundant crop.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer, to increase her crop for the welfare of her family

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 52 years old and widowed with nine children. Luisa works very hard to provide for them.

Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, bread, spices, coffee and other personal care products.

Luisa has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, bread, spices, coffee and other personal care products

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 31 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Maricris works very hard to provide for them.

Maricris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Maricris has been in this business for 1 year now. 

In the future, Maricris would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Allyn Joy

texts.en:
Allyn Joy is 24-years-old, a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Allyn Joy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Allyn Joy requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Allyn Joy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Allyn Joy would like to save enough money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai, born in 1967, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman currently living with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from farming of custard apples, grafted longan and breeding to get additional food for their daily meals and more income for the family. The income from farming is just enough to cover the living expenses for the family and she can save a very small amount of money. However, the saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the garden of custard apple and grafted longan. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the mentioned garden above.  
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her invest effectively in the garden with the expectation that the coming season of custard apples, grafted longan will be laden with fruits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her custard apple and longan trees, so that they will bear a lot of fruit

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Thuy, 45 years old, joined the program of forerunner of M7-MFI in January 1999. Her family has five members, including her husband, her son, and her daughter in law and her grandson fully 15 months. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding, so her annual income after deducting living expenses and investing costs, just a small amount remains. She intends to expand raising cow/bull to pull a plow and goats for meat but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in breeding.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in breeding, and next year she expects the breeding model will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy a bull for plowing and to invest in breeding goats, in order to help her family

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care and other groceries, She wants to send her kids to college

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 38 years old and married with three children. With three children are still school, Margie  works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Margie has been in this business for 9 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, so the profit may be used for college fees for her children

loans.name: Toan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Toan, 58 years old, is a Kinh ethnic woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI since its first operation. She always well complies with the regulations and policies of the organization, and is willing to help other people who are facing difficulties. She is living with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income mainly based on her husband’s civil servant meager salary, so it is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and she can save a small amount of money. 

She intends to raise pigs to make additional income for the family, but the saved amount is not enough to buy breeding pigs and food. That is the reason why she wants to borrow a loan. 
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding model. Next year the breeding will bring her family some pig herds with a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs for future profits and food for them

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old and married with six children. With six children in school, Raquel works very hard to provide for them.

Raquel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Raquel has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maricel has a buy and sell personal care products business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more personal care products to sell to her customers.

Maricel has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal care products to sell to her customers and make funds for education

loans.name: Mirabella

texts.en:
Mirabella works hard to support her family. Mirabella is married and has a shell crafts business in the Philippines.

Mirabella requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy material to be used in her business.

Mirabella has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy material to be used in her shell crafts business and secure the future of her family

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 30 years old and has a live-in partner, with one child. Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries such as shampoo, canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, spices, eggs, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rowena has been in this business for 7 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as shampoo, canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, spices, eggs, etc

loans.name: Saleha

texts.en:
Saleha is a widow with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Saleha is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Saleha has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business like sugar, oil, etc..

Saleha has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Saleha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business like sugar, oil, etc. to provide a living for her family

loans.name: Lubi Margoth

texts.es: Margoth tiene 28 años de edad, ella esta casada  y tiene una hija de 5 años y esta estudiando, Margoth vive en el campo y comenta que  para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a sobre todo de vacas lecheras. Margoth necesita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca ya que con el ordeño y venta de la leche es como obtiene sus ingreso y puede cubrir las necesidades basicas de su hija. Margoth comenta que junto a sus esposo  estan ahorrando un capital para comprar una casa.
texts.en: Margoth is 28 years old. She is married and has one 5 year-old daughter who goes to school. Margoth lives in the countryside and describes how she makes a living by raising livestock, especially dairy cows. Margoth needs the loan to buy a cow as selling milk is how she earns the money that enables her to cover her daughter's basic needs.
