Margoth also describes how she and her husband are saving up to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.ru: Юлдуз молодая женщина в возрасте 41 года. Она проживает в сельской местности и имеет небольшой магазинчик около дома, где продает продукты питания и товары для хозяйства. У Юлдуз 2 сына, старший учится в университете на программиста, а младший учится в школе. Юлдуз с мужем работают не покладая рук чтобы обеспечить своей семье безбедное существование. Муж Юлдуз работает на стройке кладчиком и по сезону ездит на заработки в Россию. Сейчас Юлдуз строит дом и те деньги что отправляет муж полностью уходят на строительство. Благодаря бизнесу Юлдуз в состоянии обеспечить семью и помогать мужу в строительстве. Сейчас у мужа возникли некоторые трудности с финансами и Юлдуз решила взять кредит, чтобы не останавливать строительство. С этой проблемой она решила обратиться в "АРВАНД" за помощью и на полученные деньги установить окна и двери в доме.
texts.en:
Yulduz is a young woman, 41 years old. She lives in the rural area and owns a small shop near her house where she sells groceries and household goods. Yulduz has two sons, the older studies in a university to become an IT specialist and the younger is still in school. 

Yulduz and her husband work tirelessly to provide a decent living for their family. Yulduz’s husband works in construction as a placer, and seasonally travels to work in Russia. Currently, Yulduz is building a house, and all the money sent by her husband goes into construction of the house. Thanks to Yulduz’s business, she is able to provide for the family and contribute money to the construction. Her husband faces financial difficulties now, which is why Yulduz decided to request a loan not to halt the building process. She decided to turn to “ARVAND” with this problem and install windows and doors in the house with the borrowed money.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows and doors.

loans.name: Amilcar Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo es un joven trabajador de 19 años de edad. Marcelo crecio en el  campo y apenas termino la secundaria tuvo que salir a trabajar ya que a sus padres no les alcansaba los recursos  para matricularlo a la uinversidad, Marcelo al igual que sus pades se dedica a la crianza de ganado y al jornal de trabajos de la agrcultura. Marcelo necesita el dinero del credito para comprar terneros y con las ganancias que esta actividad le genere poder pagar la matricula de la universidad.
texts.en:
Marcelo, 19, is a young worker. He grew up in the countryside and right after finishing high school he had to start working because his parents could not afford to pay his studies at the university. Marcelo and his parents work raising animals and as day laborers for different farms.

Marcelo needs the loan to buy calves. With the profits he will receive from his business, he will pay the university enrollment fee.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Roque

texts.es: En el año 1985, Roque de 55 años de edad inició una pequeña carpintería, después de haberse dedicado por mucho tiempo a pintar puertas, ventanas y sillas de cocinas, Poco a poco aprendió el oficio de su experiencia observadora e  inició con un pequeño capital, vendiéndole a vecinos y amistades comprando mucha materia prima y elaborando los diseños señalados por su clientela. Hoy su meta de crecimiento no se detiene y espera en un futuro poder comprar su propia vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará madera, pegante, pintura, clavos etc en un mayor volumen para elaborar novedosos diseños e impactar la decisión de compra de su clientela e incrementar sus ventas, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
In 1985 Roque, who is 55 years old, started a small carpentry after making a living painting doors, windows and kitchen chairs for a long time. 

Little by little he learnt the trade through experience and observation, and then started selling to neighbors and friends. He is buying a lot of raw materials and builds custom designs for his customers. To this day, his goal of growth remains the same and he hopes to be able to buy his own home in the future.

Now he is requestong a Kiva loan, for the first time through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy wood, glue, paint, nails, etc. at whole sale to develop new designs, convince his customer's to buy and increase his sales, and therefore make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, paint, nails, et cetera

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está integrado por cuatro señoras, todas vecinas de la misma comunidad rural de Monterrey, por más de diez años. Tienen sus actividades productivas en marcha, y sus clientes son la subasta y una chicharronera de la comunidad. Todas se dedican al engorde de cerdos y ganado, con al finalidad de poder aportar económicamente en sus hogares. Éstas tierras fueron donadas por el IDA a éstas familias, debido a ésto son trabajadas por la misma familia y son la principal fuente de ingresos a sus hogares. María Neri es una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 50 años de edad, casada, ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos junto con su esposo. También sale a trabajar a una soda en ocasiones, para apoyar la economía de su hogar porque su esposo está enfermo y no puede hacerlo. Tiene dos hijos mayores de edad que dependen de sus ingresos, debido a que estudian y ella les paga los gastos. Este crédito lo necesita para comprar más cerdos, asi aumentar los ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of four ladies. They all have lived in Monterrey, a rural community, for more than ten years. They all have their own businesses, and their customers are the livestock auction market and the community’s chicharronera [a place where they sell pork products]. They all raise pigs and cattle; this is how they contribute to their family’s economy. IDA [Costa Rica’s governmental institute for rural development] gave these families land. The families work this land, which represents their main source of income.

María Neri is one of the members of this group. She is 50 years old and married. She and her husband raise pigs. Sometimes she works at a small restaurant in order to contribute to the family’s economy, since her husband is sick and cannot do it. She has two adult children who depend on her, because they are studying and she pays for their studies.

María Neri is requesting a loan to buy more pigs, increase her income, and improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is 38 years old and married. She supports five family members.

She has been operating her hardware business for the last nine years. The business earns her a monthly income of 12,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

Milicent has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock for her hardware business for more income gain.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her agricultural sector.

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her hardware business.

loans.name: Kernise

texts.fr: Kernise, 37 ans, est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant. Elle vit chez ses parents. A coté de la maison familiale, elle a installé son stand de marchandises. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques : lotion de beauté, savons, dentifrices, etc. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour doubler son stock de savons de toilette.
texts.en: Kernise, 37 years old, is single and does not have children.  She lives with her parents.  She has put her merchandise stand next to her family's house.  She sells cosmetic products: beauty lotion, soaps, toothpaste etc.  She needs a microloan to double her stock of soaps.

loans.use: to buy soaps

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: Emmanuel, 27 ans, vit avec sa compagne et leurs deux enfants Bon Repos. Sans emploi, il a décidé d’ouvrir un petit commerce pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il vend des Pèpè (vêtements d’occasion). Le microcrédit lui permet de d’augmenter son stock et de développer son activité doucement.
texts.en: Emmanuel, 27 years old, lives with his girlfriend and their two children.  Without a job, he decided to open a small business to fulfill the needs of the family.  He sells "Pèpès" (secondhand clothes).  The microloan will allow him to increase his stock and slowly develop his activity.

loans.use: renew his stock of men's jeans

loans.name: Flor De Canela Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE CANELA” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de medias, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de ventanas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que es hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un poco capital y ambulando por las ferias, con el pasar del tiempo decide adquirir un espacio propio y ampliar su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE CANELA” communal bank group is in its eleventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Panamerica. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Antonia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank group have are varied and among them are vegetable sales, food sales, sock sales, food sales, clothing sales, and window sales. 
	
The loan that they will get will benefit the small business owners of which Antonia is one. She says that eight years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling vegetables. She says that she began this business with a little capital and by walking through fairs. With the passing of time, she decided to get her own space and expand her business. 
 
The loan that she is getting now is to increase her capital (purchase vegetables in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, since she is married and has five children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Nelcy

texts.es: Nelcy de 48 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos en las edades de 3 a 18 años. Su suegra siempre se ha dedicado a la preparación de alimentos en su negocio donde le ayudaba el cónyuge de Necy y por eso ella aprendió. Hoy tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas y genera ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su hogar. Cuando inició en el año 2007, lo hizo ofreciendo desayunos, meriendas, jugos naturales y otras delicias, hoy aunque se dedica a lo mismo ha agregado variedad a los productos que prepara y por eso es muy reconocida en el sector donde habita y tiene su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos alimenticios al por mayor, reduciendo los costos de los mismos y aumentando la posibilidad de vender mucho más y ganar así mismo, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa..
texts.en:
Nelcy is 48 years old and a mother of five children between the age of 3 and 18. Her mother-in-law always made a living with her own food preparing business, where Nelcy's spouse used to help out and therefore she also learned the trade.

Today she has her own business of producing and selling quick meals and generates an income to support her household. When she started in 2007, she offered breakfasts, afternoon snacks, natural juices and other delicacies. Today, and although she is still doing the same, she has added a variety of products she prepares, which is why she is well known in the area where she lives in and has her business.

Now she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first funding with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy ingredients at whole sale, to reduce their costs and giving her the opportunity to sell much more and earn more, and thus making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at whole sale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira de 55 años de edad es comerciante de productos variados, como ropa, calzado, accesorios femeninos, textos, ariculos educativos etc,Ella tiene en un pequeño local contiguo a su vivienda una miscelanea o punto comercial que la vecindad conoce y acude permanetemente a comprarle de acuerdo con sus necesidades. Su negocio inicó en el año 2001 cuando decidida a tener sus propios ingresos para ayudar a su familia inició su propia aventura emprendedora que le funcionó y hasta la presenta le crea muchas expectativas de crecimiento que la impulsan a trabajar de manera consistente para lograr continuar apoyando a su familia. En la actualidad está ap´licando a un credikiva, primer financiemtno que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,mediante el cual comprará utiles, textos, ropa y accesorios, que rotan permentemente  y ella debe propiciar inventarios que impacten a su clientela, evitando carecer de lo que requieren sus compradores, para sostenerlos atentos a su excelente oferta. Con esta inversión prevee atender la demanda de su mercado haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Elvira is 55 years old and a merchant of various products such as clothing, shoes, feminine accessories, texts, educational articles, etc. She has a small store next to her house. It is a corner store or commercial spot that the neighborhood knows and permanently uses to purchase according to their needs. Her business began in 2001 when she decided to have her own income to help her family. She started her own enterprising adventure that worked for her and even now creates a lot of growth expectations that drive her to work consistently to be able to continue supporting her family. 

Now she is applying for a credikiva, the first funding that she asks for from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy supplies, texts, clothing and accessories that will permanently rotate. She should promote inventory that impacts her customers, avoiding lacking what her buyers need to keep them attentive to her excellent offer. 

With this investment, she foresees meeting the demand of her market, making her credikiva a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy supplies, texts, clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes

loans.name: Arca De Noe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARCA DE NOE” iniciará el trigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mercedes es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas de alpaca y vicuña, venta de ropa, venta de calzados, venta de chompas, venta de mandiles, venta de mantas de lana, venta de calzados, taller de carpintería.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mercedes es integrante, ella indica que hace tres año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una cuñada que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia ya que conocía la forma de tejido y comercialización de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ARCA DE NOE” communal bank group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Adela. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers, of whom Mercedes is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank group have are varied and among them are: the sale of blankets made from alpaca and vicuña, clothing sales, woolen blanket sales, show sales, carpentry shop.

The loan that they are getting will benefit the small business owners of whom Mercedes is one. She says that three years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a sister-in-law who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling blankets. She says that she learned this business from her own initiative since she knew the way of weaving and selling this product. 

The loan that she is now getting is to increase her capital (purchase wool in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later, after production, will sell it upon the customer's request. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is single and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center and the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk.

loans.name: Reynas De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “REYNAS DE COLLPANI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Reyna es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de busos, venta de ropa, venta de alcohol, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de busos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Reyna es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de alimento de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace dos años, adquiriendo el conocimiento de la comercialización que observó en el mercado y decidió emprenderlo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “REYNAS DE COLLPANI” communal bank group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Reyna is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank group have are varied. Among them are the sale of sports clothing, alcohol sales, clothing sales, a neighborhood sale, blanket sales, sweater sales, sales of sports clothing. 

The loan that they are getting will benefit the small business owners of whom Reyna is one. She says that a year ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling fruit. She says that she began this business two years ago, gaining the knowledge of sales that she observed in the marked and she decided to undertake it. 

The loan that she is now getting is to increase her capital (purchase fruit in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has five children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Grethel Guissel

texts.es:
Los negocios siempre han estado presente en la vida de Gretel, ya que su familia posee una tienda dedicada a la venta de artesanías y de comida.  Sin embargo, desde hace más de 6 años ella ha comenzado a hacerse cargo de ambos negocios, y con las ganancias ha podido ampliar su casa. Además de ganar concursos culinarios, gracias a la calidad de sus productos.
 
Por ello, solicita un crédito para la compra artesanías, granos básicos, vegetales, aceite, carne, etc. Que le ayudará con la elaboración de su comíderia y la venta de artesanías. En consiguiente, podrá aumentar las ganancias y obtendrás más clientes. Además, Gretel planea crear un catálogo donde se muestren los artículos artesanales que ofrece.
texts.en:
Business was always a part of Grethel's life, because her family owns a store that sells handicrafts and food.

However, more than six sears ago, she began to take charge of both businesses. With the earnings she was able to extend her house. Also, she won culinary contests, thanks to the quality of her products.

She is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts, basic grains, vegetables, oil, meat, etc., which will help her to with the production of her food and the sales of handicrafts. As a result, she will be able to increase her income and attract more customers. Grethel also plans on creating a catalog, that will demonstrate the handicraft products she is offering.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts, basic grains, vegetables, oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Jiltañani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JILTAÑANI” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de tapicería, venta de polainas, venta de polleras, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de muebles, venta de joyas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un negocio anterior, donde trabajaba de empleada, es por ello que decide iniciar un negocio independiente ya que conocía la forma de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación que ofrece la institución y compartir con su banca comunal.
texts.en:
The “JILTAÑANI” communal bank group will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II. It is made up of nine members and is led by officers, of whom Maria is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank group have are varied and among them are upholstery service, leggings sales, pollera [traditional Andean skirt] sales, cosmetics sales, food sales, clothing sales, furniture sales, jewelry sales. 

The loan that they will get will benefit the small business owners, of whom Maria is one. She says that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling blankets. She says that she learned this business from a previous business where she worked as an employee. For this, she decided to begin an independent business since she knew this way of selling. 
	
The loan that she is getting now is to increase her capital (purchase blankets in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and will later sell at the fairs in the city of El Alto. This type of work permits her generate resources to support her family since she is in a common-law marriage and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers and to share with her communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase blankets in bulk.

loans.name: Kori Ampara Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY AMPARA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de busos, venta de ropa, venta de alcohol, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de busos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de Joyas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace dos años, adquiriendo el conocimiento de la comercialización que observó en el mercado y decidió emprenderlo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra joyas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “KORY AMPARA” communal bank group will begin its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of nine members and is led by officers, of whom Rosmery is the president. The businesses that the member of the communal bank group have are varied and among them are: the sale of sports clothing, clothing sales, alcohol sales, clothing sales, a neighborhood store, blanket sales, sweater sales, and the sale of sports clothing. 

The loan that they will get will benefit the small business owners of whom Rosmery is one. She says that ten years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling jewelry. She says that she began this business two years ago, having gained the knowledge of its sale which she observed in the market and she decided to undertake it.

The loan that she is now getting is to increase her capital (purchase jewelry in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work permits her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is single and has one child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Rosiris

texts.es: Rosiris de 40 años de edad, se dedica a la confección y elaboración de muñecas de trapo. Ella hace 17 años inició su experiencia, después de capacitarse en este arte y lograr ahorrar para comprar algunos materiales con los que empezó a confeccionar. Sus principales productos son las muñecas  y adornos que vende entre sus vecinos a crédito y de contado, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde diariamente  y comprando a proveedores que le ofrecen los mejores precios, para ser mucho mas competitiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, telas, hilos, e insumos, con el fin de ofrecer novedosos diseños e incrementar sus ventas, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Rosiris, 40 years old, works sewing and making rag dolls. She began her experience 17 years ago after getting training in this art and managing to save up to purchase some materials which which she began creating. Her primary products are dolls and decorations that she sells to her neighbors on credit and in cash, working from 8 in the morning until 6 at night every day and purchasing from suppliers who offer the best prices to be much more competitive. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase raw materials -- fabric, thread and supplies, with the end of offering new designs and increasing her sales, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials -- fabric, thread, and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pasta (macaroni and spaghetti)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 2 display cases and general accessories.

loans.name: Omer

texts.es: Omer de 41 años de edad, es el propietario de una peluquería ubicada en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijas en las edades de 8 a 19 años. Hace 6 años inició este negocio, cuando aprendiendo de su cónyuge,  logró ahorros que convirtió en su capital semilla,e invirtió en herramientas de peluquería con las cuales inició al observar que habia una gran demanda y no existian salones de peluquería. Poco a poco el negocio de Omer fue creciendo y hoy sus metas son mayores, pues planea mas adelante tener su propio local en un centro comercial bien ubicado y finalmente con lo que genera su negocio, hacer mejoras a su apartamento, aunque su gran desafio sea obtener un capital de trabajo suficiente para lograrlo. En la actualidad Omer está aplicando a un creidkiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará herramienta de cortes de cabello e inusmos de peluquería, con lo cual su inventario de productos se incrementará, impulsando la actividad comercial simultaneamente al servicio de corte de cabello que Omer ofrece.
texts.en: Omer, 41 years old, is the owner of a beauty salon located in a metropolitan municipal area of Barranquilla city, where he lives with his spouse and his three daughters between the ages of 8 and 19. Six years ago, he began this business, when learning from his spouse, he managed to save up and converted this seed capital and invested in beauty salon tools with which he began to observe that there was a high demand and there weren't beauty salons. Little by little, Omer's business grew and today his goals are bigger, since he plans in the future to have his own retail space in a well-situated mall and finally, with what his business generates, make improvements to his apartment although his big challenge is to get sufficient working capital to achieve it. Currently, Omer is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase hair cutting tools and beauty salon supplies, with which his product inventory will increase, boosting commercial business as well as hair cutting services that Omer offers.

loans.use: to purchase hair cutting tools and beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Javier Francisco

texts.es:
Javier tiene más de 10 años de haber iniciado su pulpería. Y gracias a los financiamientos de MiCrédito, ha podido invertir en la compra de productos para abastecer su negocio, aumentar su clientela y generar más ganancias. 

Por ello, solicita un nuevo crédito que lo utilizará para la compra de granos básicos, gaseosas, golosinas, vegetales, pan, etc. Con lo cual mejorará su pulpería y con los ingresos ampliará su negocio.
texts.en:
Javier has had his grocery store for more than 10 years. And, thanks to the financing from MiCrédito, he has been able to invest in the purchase of products to stock his business, increase his customer base, and generate more profit.

Therefore, he is requesting a new loan which he will use to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, candy, vegetables, bread, etc., with which he will improve his grocery store and, with the revenue, expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, candy, vegetables, bread, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
La educación es un derecho universal, inherente a toda persona, sin embargo acceder a ella, requiere de contar con las herramientas necesarias. Carlos es testigo de ello pues actualmente cursa segundo año de Contaduría Pública y Finanzas.

Por ello, solicita un crédito para la compra de una computadora que le servirá como herramienta tecnológica para desarrollarse como profesional.  Carlos planea graduarse con honores y comenzar lo más pronto posibles su vida laboral.
texts.en: Education is a universal right, inherent to every person. However, to access to it, one needs to have the necessary tools. Carlos is a witness of this, because currently he is in his second year of Public Accounting and Finances. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a computer, that will be useful to him as a technological tool to develop professionally. Carlos plans to graduate with Honors and start his work life as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional skirts

loans.name: Russel

texts.es: Russel de 21 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad comercial mediante guias especializadas de productos a través de los cuales promociona, labiales, perfumería, accesorios femninos etc. Su negocio inicó hace 3 años, cuando decididamente emprendió la actividad, despues de haber estudiado el margen de utilidades que esta producia, impulsado por un estudio en el que habia participado en la universidad donde cursa su carrera profesional. Hoy sus sueños no se detienen y está decidido a fortalecer su negocio cada vez mas, pues su mayor desafio es lograr apoyar a sus padres, quienes tambien tienen su propio negocio. En la actividad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cosméticos, ropa, calzdo, perfumeria, colonias, compra que hará en base a los pedidos que han realizado sus clientes. Su mayor desafio es no tener el sufieinte capital de trabajo para impulsar la venta, aun así su inversión será exitosa pues responderá a su necesidad de tener una mayor capacidad de compra y esto hace que su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en: Russel, 21 years old, works in the commercial activity through specialized guides of products through which he sells lipstick, perfume, women's accessories, etc. He began his business 3 years ago, when he undertook the work with certainty, after having studied the marginal utility of this product, boosted by a study that he had participated in at the university where he was working on his professional degree. Today, his dreams haven't stopped and he is determined to strengthen his business even more, since his major challenge is managing to support his parents who also have their own business. In this business, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase cosmetics, clothing, shoes, perfumes, and cologne, purchases that he will make on the base of the orders that his customers have made. His greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to boost sales, although with his investment it will be successful since it will respond to his need to have a better capacity for purchasing and this will make his Kiva loan very successful.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, clothing, shoes, perfumes, and cologne.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pieces of fabric to make traditional skirts

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.fr:
Rizalina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rizalina is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rizalina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rizalina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Rizalina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rizalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
texts.en:
Rizalina, 35, is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rizalina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Rizalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Rizalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Eduardo José

texts.es:
Eduardo es un joven responsable y soñador, por ello se esfuerza en salir adelante con sus estudios universitarios. Él estudia y trabaja a la vez, para apoyarse con sus gastos personales y académicos, ya que esta en cuarto año de mercadeo y publicidad, a punto de terminar su carrera.    

Por lo cual, solicita un crédito para pagar un curso de titulación y los últimos aranceles universitarios. Para poder finalizar sus estudios lo más pronto posibles. Eduardo planea iniciar un negocio  y comenzar su vida laboral en el área de su profesión.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a responsible young man who has a dream and that is why he is making efforts to get ahead with his college studies.

He is studying and working at the same time to support his personal and academic expenses. He is now in his fourth year of marketing and advertising, almost finished with his degree studies.

Eduardo is requesting the loan to pay for tuition and the final college fees, so that he can complete his degree as soon as possible. He plans to start a business and work in his professional field.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and the final college fees.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Family, progress, and constant improvement are the thoughts and priorities of Agnes, a 48-year-old small holder farmer. Agnes is a hardworking mother and farmer who is easy to get along with. She hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. Agnes is happily married and blessed with four lovely children. 

She passionately loves dairy farming and has been practicing it for the past decade. She has never regretted starting to farm. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, and crop farming. Milking and feeding her cows is the most enjoyable part about farming. Agnes is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family and she has always yearned to produce more dairy milk. 

The major challenge she faces is feeding her cows. Agnes is requesting a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device for cutting hay into small pieces to mix together with other forage to feed the cattle. With this loan, her cows will be aided in digestion and they will never reject any part of their food. Agnes strongly believes that proper feeding of the cows will lead to increased milk production, which will translate into more sales and a better income.

Through this loan, Agnes’s life is going to change permanently. Because of this high milk production potential, she will save more money to fully repay the loan. She believes that, through careful selection and the application of strict standards of excellence in keeping her dairy cows, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter, a mechanical device for cutting hay into small pieces to mix with other forage to feed the cattle.

loans.name: Roberto José

texts.es:
Roberto confía en que la educación es la única llave, que nos va a llegar al progreso personal y social.  Él  es estudiante de quinto año de  contabilidad pública y está a solo un paso de convertirse en un profesional egresado. 

Por ello, solicita un crédito para el pago de un curso de titulación que le ayudará a graduarse cuanto antes. En consiguiente, podrá optar a puestos de trabajo con respecto a su perfil profesional. Y paulatinamente, con los ingresos ampliará su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roberto trusts that education is the only key that will bring us to personal and social progress. He is a fifth-year public-accounting student and is just one step away from becoming a professional graduate.

Therefore, he is requesting a loan to be able to pay a degree course that will help him graduate sooner. As a result, he will be able to qualify for jobs in accordance with his professional profile. And, gradually, with the income he will expand his home.

loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas, 54, is a married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Felicitas has a personal products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.  

Felicitas requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of personal care products to sell.

In the future, Felicitas would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal care products to sell.

In the future, Viodelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Vilma is 57 years old, married and has four children. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now.  

Vilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Ana Lee

texts.en:
Ana Lee is 44 years old, married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ana Lee has a food production business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Ana Lee requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy kitchen wares and ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Ana Lee would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy kitchen wares and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: 6 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE MAYO” iniciará el ciclo vigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eulalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, venta de prendas de vestir de lana para niños, venta de mantillas, venta de flores, venta de salchipapa, venta de mantas, venta de lana. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eulalia es integrante, ella indica que hace doce años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que fue cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años aprendiendo la venta de su amiga. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra papa, aceite y salchicha por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo elaborara y lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta ausente una de las cliente, la misma se marcho por motivos personales
texts.en:
The communal bank "6 DE MAYO" will start its fourteenth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office. It is comprised of ten members and is directed by a board of directors, where Eulalia is president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them are: fruit sales, children's wool clothing sales, shawl sales, flower sales, hotdog and french-fry sales, blanket sales, and wool sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit small microenterprises where Eulalia is a member. She states that she became a member of Pro Mujer twelve years ago, having been invited by a friend who was a client of the institution. Nowadays, she has a business selling fried hotdogs and french fries; she informed us that she started this business several years ago after having learned the trade from her friend.

The loan that the she will take out now is to increase the capital (purchase wholesale potatoes, oil, and hotdogs that she will acquire from the vendors of the city of El Alto) and, later, to make and sell fried hotdogs and french fries in her retail space. This manner of working permits her to generate revenue to support her family economically, since she is married and has two children. 

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health-related area and the trainings that the institution offers. 

One of the members is absent in the photo. She left for personal reasons.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale oil, potatoes, and hot dogs.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 65 years old, married and has one child.

Sabina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years now, and she also earns additional income from crafts. She has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Sabina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annalyn is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Annalyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annalyn requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items and other supplies for her fishing business.

Annalyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Annalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items and other supplies for her fishing business

loans.name: Elineta

texts.en:
Elineta is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elineta is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Elineta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elineta requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Elineta has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Elineta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is only one of those entrepreneurs who are facing everyday challenges in business and life. She believes that one should endure any hardships and difficulties with footsteps before reaching on top. And she aims to be on top, that is why she is really working hard to build a stable source of income for her family.

Her variety store is helping her provide for their daily needs. She wants to prosper through this business and she automatically grabs every opportunity that comes along her way. She already availed her first loan through Kiva and repaid it successfully. 

So this time, she is asking again for your support to be able to raise the necessary amount which she needs to buy more supplies of groceries and other products for her store. A PhP 50,000 worth of loan assistance will definitely increase her inventory, which means a bigger return on her investments.

Marifel wants to buy a car from her earnings and savings. She dreams to give her family a happier and better life in the future, She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy an automobile from the profits from selling grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 47 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries.

Lucia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maribeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Maribeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her food stall for her fish vending business.

Maribeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.  To help pay for her kids college education

loans.name: Aida

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ruchele

loans.name: Ruth

Ruth has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell beverages for 10 years and also earns an income from general store.

Ruth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beverages to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

Ofelia has been in this business for 40 years now.

loans.name: Verna

loans.name: Eufemia

Eufemia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Maria Fe

As a married mother of three children, Maria Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Maria Fe is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture making business.

Maria Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 54 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Virginia has a buying and selling of home care products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, etc.

Virginia has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 64 years old and has 11 children. She is a widow and has children who are still in school.

Dolores is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 45 years old and has three children. Yolanda is married, and one of her children is in school.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Yolanda has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Yenecid

texts.es: Yenecid  de 31 años de edad, se dedica a la actividad comercial y también ofrece el servicio de venta de minutos a celulares, desde hace 5 años, cuando procedente del Chocó, municipio   localizado en el noroeste del país  en la región del Pacífico colombiano, llegó al departamento del Atlántico como consecuencia del desplazamiento de esa época, y aun habita en Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 6 y 9 años. Yenecid  Inició su negocio impulsada por  la necesidad de sufragar los gastos del hogar, y desde esa época no se detiene; ella empezó vendiendo  mercancías variadas y económicas, entre sus más allegados y posteriormente agregó la oferta de minutos a celulares, aprovechando la clientela que poco a poco estaba captando; hoy ha agregado artículos que promociona, mediante guías especializadas de productos y su meta es tener el suficiente recurso financiero, para incrementar el número de clientes y más adelante ganar más, para adecuar su infraestructura locativa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  galletas, dulces, cosméticos, perfumería, productos capilares etc. Con esta inversión planea aumentar sus ventas y así mismo sus utilidades que se convierten en ingresos familiar para apoyar de manera mas consistente el bienestar de su hogar, Todo ello lleva a que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Yenecid  is 31 years old. For the past 5 years, she has worked in commercial trade and also sells cell phone recharge services. She arrived to the department of Atlantico from Choco, a municipality located in the northeastern part of the country in the Colombian Pacific region, as a consequence of the displacement of that time. She still lives in Barranquilla with her common law husband and her 2 children ages 6 and 9 years old. Yenecid started her business motivated by the need to cover their household expenses. She hasn't stopped since then. She started selling an assortment of inexpensive merchandise among her close friends,  and later she began her cell phone recharge business, taking advantage of the client base she was already attracting. Today, she has added products she promotes through a product catalog.  Her goal is to have enough financial resources to increase her client base and earn more later to improve her location infrastructure. Currently she is is applying to a credikiva, the first loan she is requesting from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will buy cookies, sweets, cosmetics, perfumes, hair care products, etc. With this investment she also plans to increase her sales, thus her profits will turn into family earnings to support her family well being in a more consistent manner. All of this will result in the credikiva becoming a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy cookies, sweets, cosmetics, perfumes, hair care products, etc.

loans.name: Tuhliboi

texts.ru: Тухлибой мужчина в возрасте 41 года, который проживает в сельской местности. Тухлибой женат и имеет троих детей. Как и многие другие жители сельских местностей Тухлибой занимается земледелием. Он выращивает пшеницу и лук. Тухлибой имеет очень большой опыт работы в сфере земледелия.Он с юного возраста начал помогать отцу заниматься земледелием и постепенно приобрел огромный опыт в этой сфере. Сейчас Тухлибой имеет несколько гектаров хорошо орошаемой земли, где он и выращивает пшеницу и лук. На данный момент ему нужно купить минеральные удобрения для своих посевов но из за небольшого спроса на прошлогодний урожай Тухлибой испытывает некоторые затруднения в финансах. С данной проблемой он решил обратиться в МДО "Арванд" за финансовой поддержкой. На полученные деньги он хочет купить селитру и другие минеральные удобрения.
texts.en: Tuhliboi is a 41-year-old man who lives in a rural area. He is married and has three children. He plants crops, like many of the people who live in rural areas. He grows wheat and onions and has lots of experience in farming. As a young child he helped his father plant crops and gradually accumulated experience in this area. Now Tuhliboi has a few hectares of good arable land where he grows wheat and onions. He currently needs to buy fertilizers for his crops, but because of the small size of last year's harvest he is having financial difficulties. To solve this problem he decided to apply for financial support with MDO Arvand. He wants to use the money to buy saltpeter and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Merlin Elizabeth

texts.es:
Merlin, de 25 años de edad, es estudiante de bachillerato, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura. 

Merlin, aparte de estudiar, cuida a su hijo y realiza los oficios de su casa, pero además vende frutas en su casa, para ayudarle a su pareja con los gastos de a casa.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono, pesticidas y semilla para sembrar maíz y hortalizas. 

Ella sueña con graduarse como bachiller y en el futuro optar por mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en: Merlin is 25 years old. She is a high school student, has a partner and a 4 year old son. Her partner works in farming. Besides her studies, Merlin takes care of her child and does her housework.In addition she sells fruits at home to help her partner with the household expenses. She will use the loan to buy manure, pesticides, and seeds to plant corn and vegetables. She dreams to finish high school and in the future apply for better job opportunities.

loans.use: To buy manure, pesticides and seeds to plant corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Barnojon

texts.en:
Barnojon is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She is living in village with her family and has two years experience doing business serving people. She is a seller in grocery store, with regular clients every day. 

She is gentle, honest and patient person. Her store is near her house and it is easy to trade there. Her first business was keeping livestock and then she became interested to do business in a grocery store. 

She wants to buy grocery products to stock her store, because the products are finishing. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy grocery products. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy grocery products, which are in demand in her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 46 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

Ana Marie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Ana Marie has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for five years and also earns an income from a bakery and restaurant.

Ana Marie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en: As a widowed parent of one child, Minerva works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Minerva is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to  purchase an additional box of fish to sell at her fish vending business. Minerva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 45 years old, in married and has eight children, of which, two are in school.

Angelita is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Angelita has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies to help with her children's education

loans.name: Jaime Rafael

texts.es:
Jaime de 36 años de edad, está casado, su esposa es ama de casa, ella se encarga del oficio del hogar y a cuidar de sus hijos.

Jaime es promotor de salud, se ha desempeñado en ese cargo durante muchos años, a pesar de ello, manifiesta que tiene que dedicarse a la agricultura para  alcanzar a cubrir todos sus gastos y para mantener a su familia.
 
Él necesita este crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, venenos, etc. para aplicar a su milpa.


Como todo buen padre, su deseo más grande es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, y además espera compartir toda su vida con su esposa.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 36, is married.  His wife is a housewife, and she takes care of the household and their children.

Jaime is a health promoter.  He has been engaged in this line of work for many years.  In spite of this, he says that he has to work in agriculture in order to cover all of their expenses and to support his family.

He needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies like compost, fertilizers, and pesticides, etc. to use on his cornfields.

Like every good father, his biggest wish is for his children to go to school and become professionals.  He also hopes to share his entire life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like compost, fertilizers, and pesticides, etc. to use on his cornfields.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, milk, candies, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Margarita dreams that one day She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, milk, candies, etc

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Anita has a seaweed business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Anita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her seaweed business

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 51 years old, married and has three children.

Elenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elenita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elenita has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Donatila

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Donatila works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Donatila is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Donatila has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil

loans.name: Celyn

texts.en:
This is Celyn, and she used her previous loan to buy more varieties of shoes and other footwear items that her customers asked her to stock. Aside from increasing her sales, the loan also helped her to meet her household needs and expenses. 

She wants to expand her business and be able to provide more for her family. She is applying for a new loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP. It will be used again to buy additional supplies of leather shoes, rubber shoes, sandals and other footwear. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs.

Celyn hopes to become successful in her business and that her profit will continue to get a boost. She dreams for her children that they will complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of leather shoes, rubber shoes, sandals and other footwear

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en: Gabriela is a 40-year-old married woman with two children ages 16 and 13. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in Panglao, Bohol, Philippines selling basic household items like noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, powdered soap, and beverages. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items for the store such as canned goods. These items are very useful in attracting more buyers, which will augment her income and help her expand her business. With additional income, she can provide her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions. She hopes her sari-sari store business will be properly managed to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn, 23, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For two years, Ailyn has had a seaweed business in the Philippines. She requested a 7000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy supplies needed for her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. In the future, Ailyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed for her seaweed business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlyn is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Arlyn has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Arlyn has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bibiana is 61 years old and has two children who are in school.

Bibiana has a handicrafts business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed to use for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Bibiana has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Bibiana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to use for her weaving and handicrafts business

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Genoveva works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Genoveva is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Genoveva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell and to help expand her business.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Candida is 57 years old now.

Candida has a farming rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Candida has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Candida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rocsan

texts.en:
Rocsan is 44 years old and married with three children.

Rocsan is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rocsan requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rocsan has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Lelimy

texts.en:
Maria Lelimy is 37 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Maria Lelimy works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Lelimy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Maria Lelimy has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Maria Lelimy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Analyn is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lyndelou

texts.en:
Lyndelou is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Lyndelou is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Lyndelou has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elizabeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 1 year now. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tiene dos lindos niños.

Luis, desde pequeño aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura, sembrando maíz y pipían, pero cuando aprendió a manejar carro y cumplió 18 años, obtuvo la licencia de conducir lo contactaron para sirve de chofer a algunas personas de su comunidad.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar insumos para sembrar pipían, porque se acerca la época lluviosa y quiere aprovechar está temporada para obtener una buena producción.

Luis, sueña con tener su propio carro, para dedicarse por completo al oficio de motorista y aumentar los ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, age 24, went to school through the ninth grade.  His is in a relationship, and his life partner devotes herself to the household chores.  He has two wonderful children.

Ever since he was little he learned to work in agriculture by planting corn and pipían [a type of squash].  However, when he learned to drive a car and turned 18, he got a driver’s license.  They hired him to be a driver for some people in his community.

The requested loan is to buy supplies to plant pipían.  The rainy season is coming, and he wants to take advantage of this time in order to get good production.

Luis dreams of having his own car so that he can be a full time driver and increase the earnings for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to plant pipían [a type of squash].

loans.name: Dolores Gilberto

texts.es:
Dolores de 35 años de edad, está casado pero aún no tiene hijos por lo tanto solo su esposa depende de él.

Dolores se dedica a la pesca, él aprendió este oficio hace 20 años, tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad lo cual le ha servido a salir adelante con su esposa.


Él necesita el crédito para reparar el motor de su lancha pesquera.

Su sueño es procrear hijos con su esposa y sentirse realizado como persona.
texts.en:
Dolores is 35 years old. He is married but does not have any children yet so only his wife depends on him.  Dolores is dedicated to fishing. He learned this job twenty years ago. He has a lot of experience with this activity which has helped him get ahead with his wife.

He needs the loan to repair the motor of his fishing boat.

His dream is to have children with his wife and to feel fulfilled as a person.

loans.use: to repair the motor of his fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick flooring, cement, and sand in order to install brick flooring at her house.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is widow and has two children. She works in government and feeds her family alone. She is well known and bright employee among colleagues. She wants to raise her sons, to give a good education in order that they will have a place of work for to benefit society. 

She wishes to finish her house. She saved up some money, but needs additional funds to finish her house. She appealed to IMON and asked a loan from KIVA lenders to finish her house. She hopes to be supported in her loan and have a better condition for living.

loans.use: to finish her house

loans.name: Nigorajon

texts.en:
Nigorajon is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers in 1992. She is living in a small, busy town. After graduation of high school she got married. She has two children and cherishes her family. She is respected and appreciated among her family members. 

She started to do business in 2011. For three years, she got experience doing business selling kids' clothing in a domestic market. She has permanent clients every day. She is planning to enlarge her business and buy an assortment of new clothes for kids. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her to do business.

loans.use: to enlarge her business and buy an assortment of new clothes for kids

loans.name: Gavharjon

texts.en:
Gavharjon is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She lives in a small and busy city with her family. She is married and has three children. Her children are adults and Gavharjon with her husband went to Russia to earn money.
