Unfortunately, her mother-in-law became older and they had to come back to Tajikistan. She started to do business with her mother in law, baking traditional pastries called “Sambusa”. This business helped them to earn money. There is a great demand to traditional pastry “Sambusa”. 

They want to enlarge their business and cook diverse meal. Gavharjon appealed to IMON and asked Kiva lenders for financial support for buying equipment for baking. She hopes her business will gain her a profit and she can feed her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment for baking Sambusas, in a business with her mother-in-law

loans.name: Jesserie

texts.en:
Jesserie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a livestock business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Jesserie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emma has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Emma has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Gemalinda

texts.en:
Gemalinda is 50 years old and has six children; three of her children are in school.

Gemalinda is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Gemalinda requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gemalinda has been farming rice for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Isidaria

texts.en:
Isidaria is 46 years old and has twelve children. Isidaria is married and has six children who are in school.

Isidaria is in the agricultural business of raising pigs and livestock in the Philippines. Isidaria requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Isidaria has been raising pigs and livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Isidaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Leono

texts.en:
Leono is 51 years old, married, and has three children. 

Leono is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Leono requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leono has been farming rice for 5 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leono would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ledis Maritza

texts.es:
Ledis, de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera y vive junto a su mamá, su hija y sus 4 sobrinos, los cuales cuida porque sus padres se encuentran en Estados Unidos trabajando, para suplir las necesidades de ellos.

Ledis, se dedica a realizar viajes en un carro, que con mucho esfuerzo ha conseguido, cuando tenía 18 años de edad viajó a Estados Unidos a trabajar, 8 años despues regresó a nuestro país y el dinero que logró ahorrar, compró un microbús y se dedicó a hacer viajes; despues de un tiempo la vendió y compro el vehículo que actualmente posee.

Ledis, necesita el crédito para pagar los gastos médicos que tuvo que hacer para que su madre se recuperará de su enfermedad, ella no tenia dinero en ese momento y tuvo que negociar con los médicos para que la atendieran y que posteriormente ella les pagaría, es por eso que necesita el dinero.

Ledis, sueña con que su hija se supere y llegue a formar un hogar, donde logre desarrollar sus sueños junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Ledis is 42 years old and studied up to Grade 3. She is a single mother who lives with her mother, her daughter and her 4 nieces and nephews. She cares for them as their parents are in the United States working to provide for their needs

Ledis works making trips in her vehicle which she got with much effort. When she was 18 years old she traveled to the United States to work. Eight years later she returned to her country and with the money she had saved she bought a micro-bus and worked transporting with her vehicle, After some time she sold it and bought the vehicle she now has. Ledis needs a loan to pay the medical costs she incurred for her mother to recuperate from a sickness. She had no money at the time and had to negotiate with the doctors to care for her mother, while paying them later. For this reason she needs the money. Ledis dreams of her daughter excelling and having a family where she can achieve her dreams together with her family.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses for her mother to recuperate from a sickness.

loans.name: Pheng's Group

texts.en:
Pheng is aged 38 years and a mother of four children, living in Kratie province. Cassava farming is the main source of her family’s income and working for other farmers is the additional source of income. She could earn about 60,000KHR per day. 

Now she is leading a group to apply for a loan with her portion to hire workers to help on the farm and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to hire workers to help on her cassava farm and pay the plowing fees

loans.name: Ten's Group

texts.en:
Ten is aged 61 years and the mother of four children, living in Kratie province.  Growing cassava and working for other farm are the sources of her family’s income for four years. She could earn about 93,000KHR per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund in order to buy farming supplies for doing farming. She hopes her business will grow well through this loan.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her cassava farm

loans.name: Amor De Dios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMOR DE DIOS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jeanette es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de busos, venta de ropa, venta de alcohol, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de busos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jeanette es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de alimento para mascotas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace dos años, adquiriendo el conocimiento de la comercialización que observó en el mercado y decidió emprenderlo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra alimento para mascotas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es unión libre y tiene cuatro, hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amor de Dios" is beginning its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors, where Jeanette is the president. 

The members have a variety of businesses, including jacket sales, clothing sales, alcohol sales, neighborhood store, blanket sales, and sweater sales.

This loan will benefit women owners of micro-enterprises, Jeanette being one of them. She comments that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer, at the invitation of a friend who is a client at the institution. 

Jeanette has a business selling pet food. She started this work two years ago, getting her knowledge through observation of the selling activity at the market, after which she decided to start her own business.

She is requesting the loan to increase her merchandise (wholesale purchase of pet food) which she will buy from vendors in the city of El Alto. She will then sell from her market stall.

This work allows her to generate resources to financially support her family. She has a partner and four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Jeanette answered that she likes the health services and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy pet food at wholesale.

loans.name: Las Intocables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS INTOCABLES” iniciará el trigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Aida es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de celulares, venta de víveres, venta de embutidos, venta de chompas, venta de chamarras, taller de cerrajería, venta de chamarras, venta de chompas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Aida es integrante, ella indica que hace veinte y tres año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una cuñada que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de víveres; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia al observar el mercado, donde identificó que pocas vendían estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los créditos que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Intocables is beginning its 32nd cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada Focal Center. It is made up of 8 members and is headed by a board where Aida is president. The members of the communal bank have varied businesses. Among them are a locksmith shop, and sales of cell phones, food, sausages, sweaters, and jackets.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro entrepreneurs where Aida is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer 23 years ago receiving an invitation from her sister-in-law who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling food. She says she learned the business on her own initiative by watching the marketplace where she identified a few products being sold.

The loan she is asking for now is to increase her capital (to buy groceries at wholesale) buying from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then later selling to her customers upon request. This form of work permits her to generate income to support her family financially since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says that she likes the health area and loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has two children and her husband is a construction master. 

She has a business keeping livestock and also buying and selling kid’s clothes. She has eight years experience in keeping livestock and trading at animal market. In buying and selling of kid’s clothes, she has six year practice. She likes her businesses and is interested to enlarge them to gain additional profit to feed her family. 

She is planning to take a loan from Kiva lenders and to buy livestock for further feeding and then selling. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock for further feeding and then selling, for the welfare of her family

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Madame ayoko une jeune femme de 29ans a pour conjoint un jardinier et 04 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Le premier a 9ans et le dernier 1an. Elle revend des sacs de charbons de bois qu'elle achète dans les villes de l'intérieur. Le quatrième crédit lui servira d'acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle souhaite avoir une activité plus grande et assurer le bien - être de la famille. Ayoko a une ancienneté de 07ans dans l'activité.
texts.en: Mrs. Ayoko is a young woman who is 29 years old, married to a gardener and has 4 children, 2 of which are in school.  Her oldest child is 9 years old and her youngest child is 1.  She resells sacks of charcoal and wood that she buys in inland cities.  Her fourth loan will allow her to buy merchandise in order to respond to the needs of her clients.  She hopes to grow her activity and ensure the well-being of her family.  Ayoko has seven years of experience in this activity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and wood

loans.name: Sarrah Jean

texts.en:
33 year old Sarrah Jean earns a livelihood by means of fishing. She sells fish to the locals in her place. She has three dependents, ages 10, 6 and 3 years old.  She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years now. In addition to this, she also engages in an oyster farming business. She grows and sells oysters.

She  is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net, nylon and bamboo. These materials are very essential in augmenting her on-going catch. With these, she will be able to improve her  sales and provide her children with nutritious diets. 

Sarrah Jean hopes that she could continue finance the schooling of her children and able to expand her business for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, nylon and bamboo

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
Delsa has successfully paid back her last loan availed through Kiva. She bought grocery items and other supplies for her business. She has been operating her own sari-sari (variety) store for two years now, and the loan assistance helped her boost her profit. She has a big family, so she really gives her all to sustain their everyday necessities.

To improve her business, Delsa would like to apply for a new loan that is amounting to 14,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase additional grocery goods and products to sell. She wants you to know in advance that she is grateful for whatever amount you will willingly lend her.

In the future, Delsa hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional grocery items and other products she needs to expand her inventory and increase her sales.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Luzviminda has a buy & sell vegetables business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell, to help pay for college fees for her children

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, home care producs and other groceries.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Florame

texts.en:
Florame works hard to support her family. Florame is married and has an ice cream making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like milk, sugar, salt, etc.

Florame has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Florame would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like milk, sugar, salt, etc

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 56 years old and has ten children. Norma is married and has three children who are in school.

Norma is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Norma requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials and tools for her business.

Norma has been in this business for 1 year now, and she has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 41 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Noralyn is borrowing 22000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer and pay for laborers' salaries.

Noralyn has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetable.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer and pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and has six children. Rebecca is married and has two children who are in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business, farming seaweed in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials and tools for her business.

Rebecca has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Irabandanya Group

texts.fr:
Grégoire fait partie du groupe  Irabandanya et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 35 ans et est marié à Joselyne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 10 ans, dont  3 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de  riz, haricot, colocase  depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Grégoire is part of the group Irabandanya and lives in  Gitega. He is 35 years old and married to Joselyne, a farmer. Together they have five children, aged 2 to 10 years old, of whom three are students. 

Grégoire has been doing commerce in rice, beans, and taro for four years. 

He is on his 2nd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large amount of rice and beans to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice and beans to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil for selling.

loans.name: Felestus

texts.en:
Felestus is a 38-year-old mother of seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. Felestus has been selling second-hand clothes for the last 15 years to earn a living. She has dreams of expanding her business, educating her children and having a room to sell her clothes. She is faced with challenges of market competition, changes in weather that affect her business since she operates from an open place, and lack of enough capital. 

She is hardworking and requests a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac deals in growing and selling cocoa, which he has practiced for many years. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He earns additional income from his school as a director and other support funds from USA in form of grants; he works hard to meet his family's basic needs and dreams of educating his children and owning a model school in his area. 

Isaac is requesting a loan to buy building materials like iron bars and cement to complete the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like iron bars and cement to complete the construction of his house.

loans.name: Vilma De La Paz

texts.es:
Vilma, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a vender periódicos en frente de su casa, es una calle muy concurrida y le va bien con la venta, en su casa vive junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos.

Vilma, realiza muchas actividades todos los días, desde tempranas horas de la mañana se dedica a vender pupusas frente a su casa, mientras su esposo vende periódico, luego en el mediodía vende almuerzos y hace tortillas para vender y posteriormente en la tarde se dedica a la venta de antojitos como (enchiladas, empanadas, tostadas, etc.)

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar insumos para la pupuseria y maíz para hacer las tortillas.

Vilma, sueña con ver progresar su negocio, de tal manera que pueda llegar a tener un comedor que le genere bastantes ganancias y así gozar de mayores comodidades para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma, 55 years old, is a very hard working woman. She finished ninth grade, is married and her husband is dedicated to selling newspapers in front of their house, on a well trafficked street and sales are going well. She lives with her husband and their two children in their house.

Vilma performs a lot of work every day. From the early hours in the morning she is dedicated to selling pupusas (a Salvadoran dish) in front of her house while her husband sells newspapers. Then, at noon, she sells lunches and makes tortillas to sell and later in the afternoon, she is dedicated to selling snacks like enchiladas, empanadas, tostadas, etc.

The loan requested is to buy ingredients for the "pupuseria" and maize to make tortillas.

Vilma dreams of seeing progress with her business in such a way that she can have a restaurant that generates good income and thus enjoy greater comfort for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant and maize to make tortillas.

loans.name: Rosa Cándida

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 38 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.

Rosa es comerciante de productos de belleza de revistas y catálogos, tiene varios años dedicándose a esta actividad, ella sale a ofrecer los productos a sus vecinas y a las personas de las demás comunidades.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más productos de belleza como lociones, cremas, desodorantes, rubores, etc para aumentar las ventas.

Ella desea convertirse en una empresaria productiva gracias a su iniciativa de venta de productos de belleza, pero también desea que sus hijos salgan adelante y darles una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old, is in a relationship and has 4 children who are studying in the school in their community. She is a vendor of beauty products from catalogs and magazines. She has been doing his for a number of years. She goes out to offer her products to her neighbors and people in other communities.

Rosa needs the loan to buy more beauty products like lotions, cream, deodorant, and blush to increase her sales. She wants to transform her business to become more productive thanks to her initiative selling beauty products. She also wants her children to get ahead and to provide them with a better life.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products like lotions, cream, deodorant, and blush to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is aged 41 years old and the mother of two children, living in Kratie province. Growing rice is the main source of her family’s income and she also works for other farms to get a fee as well. She has been involved in these businesses for twenty three years and it earns her about 40,800KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan to buy farming supplies for doing farming. She hopes to earn more money too and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice farming supplies for her farm

loans.name: Suy's Group

texts.en:
Suy, 61, is a mother of five children, living in Kampong Thom province. Growing rice and working for other farm for fee are the sources of her family’s income. She has been involved in these businesses for a long time and she could earn about 37,500KHR per day. 

In order to improve her family’s standard of living, she wants to build a private toilet for family. Because she lacks money to do so, she is now leading a group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to build a decent latrine. She hopes her family members will have a good health through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for the welfare of her family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Yul's Group

texts.en:
Yul, 24, is a rice farmer, living in Kampong Thom province. She has been growing rice around five years and fishing is an additional source of her family’s income. 

Due to lack of money to fulfill her needs, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy a decent latrine. She hopes to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for the welfare of her family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren is a rural villager living in Kampong Thom province. She is a mother of four children, and two of them are in school. Growing rice and working for other farms are the sources of her family’s income for more than five years and it earns her 35,000KHR per day. 

She is now leading a group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner to buy a decent latrine. She hopes her family will have a better living condition and remain healthy.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for the health of her family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Leap, 48, is a mother of three children, living in Kampong Thom province. Rice farming is the source of her family’s income for twenty year. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner to buy a decent latrine. She hopes her all family will have good health because of this.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for the health and welfare of her family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Soeung's Group

texts.en:
Soeung is age 45 years old and a mother of four children. She is living in Kampong Thom province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and working for other farms for a fee. She could earn about 80,000 KHR per day. 

Due to having not enough money to fulfill her needs, she is now leading a group to take a loan with VisionFund to buy a decent latrine. She hopes her family members will have good health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea, 43, is a mother of two children. She is living in Kampong Thom province. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years. She could earn about 80,000 KHR per day. 

Now she is leading a group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will use her loan portion to build a private toilet for her family. She hopes to improve her standard of living and keep all her family members healthy.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Run, 52, is a married woman living in Kampong Thom province. She has been a rice farmer for more than five years, and it earns her about 40,000KHR per day. 

Now she is leading a group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to build a private toilet for her family. 

She hopes that her family's members will have good health through this loan purpose.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Doeung's Group

texts.en:
Doeung is age 48 years old, a married mother of four children, one of them is a dependent child. She is a grocery seller and a rice farmer living in Kampong Thom province. She has been involved in this business for 10 years, and it earns her about 50,000KHR per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, she’s now leading a group to apply for a loan with her portion to build a private toilet for her family. 

She hopes that her family members will have good health.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

loans.name: Umme Hani

texts.en:
Umme Hani is the age of 46. She is living with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is a bookbinder and binds book at home. She financially supports her family through her bookbinding work. She uses cardboard, loop wire, gum and thread for bookbinding. She takes orders from book publishers and binds books on order. 

For the time being, she has been filling many contracts, but this time she has gotten a huge contract earlier. A major problem is that she does not have enough cash on hand to buy raw materials for bookbinding. 

Therefore, Umme Hani requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy raw materials such as cardboard, loop wire, gum, threads, etc., to enhance her business. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to enhance her own bookbinding work by buying raw materials

loans.name: Walayat Bibi

texts.en:
Walayat Bibi is a 52-year-old married woman. She is living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. She is doing embroidery work by her hands at home and financially supporting her family.

She belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start doing embroidery work at home. She learned this art in her childhood; now she adopted it for her occupation. She enabled herself to be independent and earn sufficient income. 

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a stock of thread, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Walayat Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of thread, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors for her own embroidery work

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Ayaovi est une femme mariée et âgée de 46 ans. Ayaovi habite dans le quartier d’Adamavo. Ayaovi est très entreprenante et dynamique et vend des sacs en se déplaçant aux besoins de ses clients afin de trouver son gain. Ayaovi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs, Ayaovi demande ce crédit pour réaliser sa commande et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Ayoavi is a married woman who is 46 years old.  Ayaovi lives in the neighborhood of Adamavo.  Ayaovi is very resourceful and dynamic and she moves around selling bags to meet the needs of her clients in order to make a living.  Ayaovi stocks up three times per month at the market.  Ayaovi requests this loan to buy more bags and to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy 30 bags

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Veuve et âgée de 44 ans, Ayaba est une femme qui vit à Adamavo. Commerçante ambulante, Ayaba vend des cures dent dans son quartier et ses alentours afin d’avoir son revenu. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Ayaba s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Ayaba demande ce crédit pour commander des tas de cure dent afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: Ayaba is a 44 year old widow who lives in Adamavo.  A traveling saleswoman, Ayaba sells toothpicks in her neighborhood and the surrounding areas in order to make a living.  To efficiently respond to the needs of her clients, Ayaba stocks up four times per month at the market.  Ayaba requests this loan to buy loads of toothpicks in order to earn more profits to favorably satisfy the her clients and fulfill her needs.

loans.use: to buy three loads of toothpicks

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER” iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wilma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de productos por catálogo, tienda de barrio, venta de productos de telefonía, venta de edredones y frazadas, venta de comida.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wilma es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, al observar que en su zona no existía un negocio similar y es por ello que decide aprovechar la oportunidad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Amanecer" will be beginning the eighteenth cycle of Pro Woman, as part of the Focal Center Waterfall, it is composed of eight members and is headed by a board with Mrs. Wilma as the president. The businesses of the members in the communal association are varied, including: the sale of clothing, selling product catalogs, neighborhood store, selling telephone products, sale of duvets and blankets, and selling food.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs where Mrs. Wilma is integral. She indicates that five years ago when she integrated Pro Woman, she was entering the invitation of a massive promotion of the institution that worked in her zone. Today she has a business selling food, and she discloses that she learned this business on her own initiative, observing that in this area there was not a similar store and this is why she decided to take advantage of the opportunity.
	
The loan that they now will request is for the increase of capital (to buy groceries wholesale) that she will acquire from selling wholesale in the city of La Paz and after, in development, she will sell in her retail space. This form of work permits her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is single and has two children.

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Woman, she responds that she likes the trainings and the health areas that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Guliniso

texts.en:
This is Guliniso. She lives with her family in the district of Shahrituz. Shahrituz is the hottest point in our country. In summer the temperature reaches higher than 50 degrees. 

Guliniso lives with her mother, brother, his wife and children.  Guliniso has not worked and now she wants to start her own business with the purchase and sales of clothing. She has rented the point of sale and has 20% of the capital from the requested amount. 

To have own business for Guliniso was a dream and now she wants to fulfill her dream. Guliniso needs your assistance.

loans.use: To start her own business with the purchase and sales of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh milk

loans.name: Amen

texts.en:
Amen is a 25-year-old single man from Deir El-Balah city. He works as an employee in the public sector with a very low income. Amen would like to improve his family living conditions, so he decided to find an additional job.

Amen took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods on it. This will help him to increase his income and provide his family with all that they need. 

Amen appears in the photo next to his rickshaw

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for the transfer goods, to help support his family

loans.name: Moyad

texts.en:
Moayd is 34-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He works as an employee in the public sector, with a very low income. 

Moayd decided to find an additional job so he bought a rickshaw one year ago. He transfer goods for the local traders on it. He took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to repair his rickshaw so he can get back to work. It will help him to increase his income and provide his family with all that they need. 

Moayd appears in the photo on his rickshaw

loans.use: to repair his rickshaw so he can get back to work and help to support his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, and metal sheets in order to build a room in his home.

loans.name: Griselda Esmeralda

texts.es: Griselda es una joven de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su madre y su hermano menor a los que apoya mostrando su calidez humana y su responsabilidad con su familia. La venta de ropa es un rubro muy demando, por lo que hace 3 años Griselda buscando la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y  la de su familia decidió invertir en ropa para vender, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante obteniendo cada día una mayor cantidad de clientes. Él negocio de la ropa es muy cambiante ya que siempre están saliendo nuevos estilos, por lo que Griselda buscando contar siempre con lo más nuevo para sus clientes solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas, camisetas, etc., y de esta manera mantener la clientela con la que cuenta y atraer más.
texts.en:
Griselda is a 23-year-old woman who lives with her mother and younger brother. By supporting them, she demonstrates the level of warmth and responsibility for her family.

Selling clothes is a job that is in very high demand. Three years ago Griselda was looking for a way to improve her quality of life and that of her family, so she decided to invest in clothes to sell. She conducts her business as a street vendor and each day she gains a large number of customers. The clothing business is constantly changing since new styles are always arriving. For this reason, Griselda is always looking to offer the latest styles to her customers.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in trousers, skirts, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, and other products. As a result, she will be able to maintain her existing clientele and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Sanam

texts.en:
Sanam is a talented woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1963. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has six children and her husband is also a farmer who keeps livestock. Sanam also does business in agriculture, so it can be considered as family business. 

She has nine year practice of taking care and keeping livestock. She has good conditions to keep livestock nearby to her house, which is situated near some hills, where she feeds and keeps her livestock. 

She has a dream to open a farm. She is going to buy additional livestock to increase her business. She asks a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy more livestock. She hopes that they will be supported.

loans.use: to buy more livestock, so that she and her husband can open a farm

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en: Nodira is a confident woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan from a family of farmers. She is living in a pretty small town with her family. She is married and has two children. She and her husband do business in agriculture. They plant wheat, watermelon, cereal, and corn on rented land. She has many years of experience doing business in agriculture. She likes to do business in this sphere because there is no other profitable and common business to do in her area. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy fertilizer and seeds of cereal. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness. This loan will help her to plant more seeds this season and to have a good harvest. Income gained from the business will be spent on her family's needs like clothing and food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds of cereal

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza is a conscientious woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. 

She does business in agriculture. She and her husband do a business planting agricultural products and selling the harvest in the domestic market. She is satisfied with her annual income and likes to have an activity in agriculture. They have permanent clients for their products in the domestic market. 

She plans to buy fertilizer and improve the land. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer, natural minerals (chemicals) and seeds. 

She hopes to have a good harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, natural minerals (chemicals) and seeds

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline engages in a fish vending business. She sells and displays fresh fish to the locals in her place. She is a 43-year-old married woman with six  children, ages 21- 9 years old.  In addition to this, she also raises and sells hogs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. This will be of great help to boost her hog-raising business. With this, she will be able raise healthy hogs and sell them in a few months. She could now prepare nutritious meals and a better shelter to live in.

She is eager to expand her both businesses for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 59, is a married woman who engages in fishing. She has been doing fishing for more than 10 years. She has twelve children, and two of them are still attending school. She lives in Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy fishing materials and fuel for the motor boat. With these, she could expand her fishing business and able to provide her children with  nutritious meals. 

Delia's goal is to improve the living condition of  her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and fuel for the motor boat, to improve the living condition of her family

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like selling vegetables. 

Leonida dreams that one day She will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhodora is 50-years-old and has three children who are in school.

Rhodora has a seaweed business in the Philippines. Rhodora requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials and tools needed for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rhodora has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rhodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rope and containers for use in her seaweed business

loans.name: Buenaros

texts.en:
Buenaros is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Buenaros is 42 years old now.

Buenaros has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy soap and other items to sell .

Buenaros has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Buenaros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soap and other items to sell and expand her business

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 49 years old and has one child. Cecelia is married and has one child in school.

Cecelia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecelia requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cecelia has been in this business for 14 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cecelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise pigs and to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 37 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Conchita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elisa is 63 years old now.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Elisa has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 35 years old with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, liquor, personal care products, school supplies, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, liquor, personal care products, school supplies, and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a hardworking entrepreneur and mother of three children.

Ma. Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice and sugarcane.

Ma. Theresa dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children. With four children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, personal care products, home care products, and other grocery items.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, personal care products, home care products, and other grocery items

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 57 years old, married and has two children.  One of her children is in school.

Maxima is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maxima has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maxima would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is a married 43-year-old woman and mother of two children. Ivy's two children are in school.

Ivy is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a personal care products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. 

Ivy requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more inventory of personal care products to offer for sale.

In the future, Ivy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of personal care products to offer for sale

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
Jeanilyn is 51 years old, married, and has seven children, two of whom attend school.

She earns a living by raising goats in the Philippines. Jeanilyn is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her goats.

Jeanilyn has been raising goats for four years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and wrap around skirts for mending and selling.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is 29 years married with 3 children living in Kasese Uganda. Salima has operatesd a retail shop of general merchandise since 2011 and also practices farming growing crops such as maize, cotton, rice and others for additional income. 

Salima has a dream of expanding her business and educating her children. However,she is faced with the challenge of seasonality factors. 

Salima needs a loan to buy soap , rice, sugar and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, sugar and other general merchandise, to increase her stock for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Jonan

texts.en:
Jonan is a 30-year-old single male with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Jonan operates an electronics shop, which he has been operating since 2010. He earns a salary as an additional income and does phone repairs. 

Jonan started the business to earn a living. He is a hard working man and is hoping to expand his business while having a stable income in order to achieve his dreams. Jonan is requesting a loan to buy radios and other electronics to sell.

loans.use: to buy radios and other electronics to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, widowed with 3 children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Maria sells mattresses and also offers secretarial services to supplement her incomes on top of what she earns from contracts. 

She usually complains of delayed payments of contracts, yet she needs the money to assist her to run her business and pay school fees for her children. Maria intends to use the loan to buy mattresses for selling.

loans.use: to buy mattresses for selling and also offer secretarial service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a house on the land her husband bought.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee de 55 años de edad, es un ejemplo de mujer luchadora, ella es viuda y ha tenido que sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos que viven con ella.

Aydee se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, pasteles y toda clase de platos típico, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, en el transcurso del tiempo ha hecho muchos clientes que siempre consumen sus productos y gracias a eso ha logrado salir adelante y darle alimentación a sus hijos.

Ella solicita este crédito para hacer una ramada más grande y comprar más papas, yuca, maíz, etc para vender platillos típicos.

Ella sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos hasta que pueden ser independientes y siempre tener su cariño pues ha hecho bastante por ellos.
texts.en:
Aydee is 55 years old. She is an exemplary woman who is a fighter. She is a widow and has had to get her 5 children who live with her ahead.   

Aydee sells french fries, pastries, and all types of traditional dishes. She has been doing this type pf work for 10 years. Over time she has gained many customers who always consume her products and thanks to this she has been able to get ahead and feed her children. 

She is asking for this loan to enlarge her business and buy more potatoes, yucca, corn, etc. to sell traditional dishes. 

Her dream is to get her children ahead so they can be independent and always have their affection, because she has done so much for them.

loans.use: to enlarge her business and buy more potatoes, yucca, corn, etc., to sell traditional foods.

loans.name: Sok Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Sok Kheng is married mother of four children, living in Kampong Cham Province. Growing cassava and rice farming are the sources of her family income for more than five years. She could earn 30,600KHR per day to support her family living. 

Now she is experiencing a lack of fund to do her farming. She has decided to apply for this loan, with her portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Sokmun

texts.en:
Sokmun is a cassava farmer, living Kampong Cham province. She is 51 years old and a mother of four children. She has been involved in this business for 33 years and it earns her 47,000KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she’s now applying for a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to earn more money and renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to help renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy is age 32 years old and a mother of three children, living in Battambang province. She is a cassava farmer and a paid worker for 12 years and it earns her 75,000KHR per day. 

She is now leading a group of three to apply for a loan via VisionFund with the portion to buy seeds and pay for plowing fee. She wants to earn more money and ability to buy farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees to help her produce cassava

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech is a married woman and a mother of five children, living in the Battambang province. She has been a cassava farmer and paid worker for 10 years. 

Pech is now applying for a loan in order to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees. She wants to have a better living condition through this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
A $800 loan is offered to Rosita to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, oils, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, slippers, candles and shampoo. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Rosita independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, oils, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, slippers, candles and shampoo

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
A $600.00 loan is offered to Silvia to improve her business.She opened her business in 2009 on her own.

She will use the loan to weave and sell traditional shawls.She is generating a good income from selling them.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To weave and sell traditional shawls

loans.name: Terezihna

texts.en:
Terezihna ia applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy more buffalo.

She opened her business in 2010 with her own working capital of $600.00. 

She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more buffalo and improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.en:
Lurdes is taking a loan of $1,500 USD to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy inventory for her store such as eggs, biscuits, body lotions, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, and oil. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00.  

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, biscuits, body lotions, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, and oil

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 37-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is passing her life with her husband, two sons and a daughter.
Her husband is very hard worker and honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods. Shabana also cooks some dishes for restaurant, and the people like to eat from her husband's restaurant. He hired a worker for his restaurant; he pays a salary to that worker. 

Shaban's husband has been running his restaurant for many years, and over time most of the chairs, utensils and crockery have broken. This is the reason he wants to buy new plastic furniture, utensils and crockery, but the majority of his income must be spent on household expenses. Therefore, Shabana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils and crockery. 

Shabana thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support given to her.

loans.use: to assist her husband in purchasing plastic furniture, utensils and crockery for his restaurant.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 49-year-old lady; she is married and spends her life with her daughter and three sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is receiving loan for her son because he owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery material for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover is very high. 

Due to high costs he is facing a shortage of material and is unable to purchase expensive raw material to sell. Therefore, Nargis requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can overcome the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount, he will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Nargis is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Nargis's son in purchasing stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.  These are used for wedding dresses

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée qui vit avec cinq enfants à sa charge. Abla habite à Adamavo et est âgée de 48 ans. Pour réaliser des gains et subvenir favorablement à ses besoins, Abla vend du sel dans son quartier et arrive à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens grâce au revenu. Abla s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché  et demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de sel. Abla désire améliorer sa prestation et augmenter son profit pour aider ses enfants
texts.en: Abla is a married woman who lives with her five children she supports. She lives in Adamavo and is 48 years old. To make a profit and to support herself, Abla sells salt in her neighborhood and manages to meet day-to-day needs, thanks to the income. She gets her supplies five time a month at the market and is asking for this loan to purchase bags of salt. Abla would like to improve her services and grow her profits in order to help out her children.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of salt

loans.name: Affi

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée, Afi vit à Adamavo avec ses trois enfants. Agée de 31 ans, Afi est une commerçante de céréales dans son quartier et satisfait agréablement ses clients. Afi trouve son revenu à travers ce commerce. Afi s’approvisionne  trois fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour commander quelque sacs de maïs, de riz et des bols d’haricot, Afi sollicite ce microcrédit pour réaliser son achat afin d’avoir le bénéfice qui pourrait soutenir son mari à favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: A married woman, Afi lives in Adamavo with her three children. She is 31 years old and a merchant of grains in her district and has been happily satisfying her customers. She has an income through this business. She gets her supplies three time a month at the Lomé market. To put in an order for a few sacks of corn and rice and for tubs of bean, Afi is requesting this micro-loan to realize her purchase, so as to have the profits which could support her husband and her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of corn, 12 tubs of beans, and a sack of rice

loans.name: Madari

texts.es: MADARI: Es una señora luchadora, afable, originaria de la comunidad Klar, que se localiza a 14 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Madre soltera de 2 hijos que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 8 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Está solicitando financiamiento para aumentar el inventario de los productos de granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con poder crear las condiciones que le permitan a su familia tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Madari is a good-natured and determined woman who is originally from the community of Klar, which is located 14 kilometers from the municipality of Waspam-Rio Coco. She is of Miskito ethnicity. Madari is a single mother with two children who are in primary school.

In order to help her children get ahead, Madari established a small store eight years ago in the corridor of her wooden stilt house. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory with products such as basic grains, yogurt, and other items. Madari dreams of creating conditions that will allow her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, yogurt, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system and water tank

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is a 30-year-old married man from Khan Younis City. 

He works as an employee in the public sector and earns a very low income. Abdel decided to find an additional job, so he bought a rickshaw three years ago. He uses the rickshaw to transfer goods for the local traders.

Abdel took a $1175 USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to repair his rickshaw so he can get back to work. This will help him to increase his income and provide his family with what they need.

Abdel appears in the photo next to his rickshaw

loans.use: to repair his rickshaw so he can get back to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, floor brick, sand and a door to install in his house.

loans.name: Hursiya

texts.en:
Hursiya is a confident woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1984. She is living in a small village with her big family. She is married and has three children. 

She has many years of practice doing business in agriculture. She keeps livestock and feeds them in order to sell in the animal market. She likes to do business and tries to take care about the quality of her livestock. 

She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy livestock. She hopes to be supported so she can feed the livestock to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Akpéné est âgée de 34ans. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, elle revend des produits d'alimentation générale depuis 2003 et demande un second crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle souhaite avoir d'autres boutiques et subvenir aux besoins des parents.
texts.en: Akpéné is 34 years old. To support herself, she has been selling grocery items since 2003 and is asking for a second loan to purchase some goods. For the future, she would like to have other stores and to meet the needs of her parents.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Rubilisa

texts.en:
Rubilisa is married and has three children. She operates a tricycle (motorcycle with side car) transportation service with her husband, which they have been doing for four years. She is in need of capital to continue to operate.

Rubilisa is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase tricycle maintenance and additional capital to restart her buy and sell business necessary to earn additional income.  With the loan, she will be able to provide her passengers with trouble-free rides. Rubilisa hopes to provide her family with good  food. Her desire is to be able to send all her children to school for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle maintenance and additional capital for buy and sell

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is a married woman with two children ages 15 and 10 year old respectively. She hails in Getafe, Bohol.
 
She has a hog raising business.  In addition to that, she also engages in selling ready-to-wear items like pants, shorts, shirts, blouses and many others. 

She has requested a loan to buy pig feed, pig supplements and also ready-to-wear supplies. She will be able to continue raising hogs and resume her clothing business. Slowly her income will improve and better her finances.
 
She is consistent in improving and handling her business to be able to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, pig supplements and more supplies for her ready-to-wear business

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 31 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Jenifer has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetable.

Jenifer aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking woman, an entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

Nida dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna is 28 years old, married, and has three children. One of her children is in school.

Meraluna is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Meraluna has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Meraluna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish business.

Ofelia has been in this business for 5 years. Ofelia earns additional income from food vending.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish to sell

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn is 35 years old, married, and has five children.  Two of her children are in school.

Rogelyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rogelyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rogelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 57 years old and has four children. Daisy is married and one of her children is still in school.

Daisy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Daisy has been this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Shiley

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Shiley works hard to support her family.

She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. 

Shiley is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

Shiley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jasmin works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making and selling peanut butter. 

Jasmin is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell to customers.

Jasmin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 68 years old, married, and has three children.

Amparo is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. Amparo requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Amparo has been this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old, married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like can goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like can goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 29 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Adelfa works very hard to provide for them.

Adelfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Adelfa has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, biscuits, soft drinks and other groceries . 

In the future, Adelfa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Annilyn

texts.en:
Annilyn is 43 years old and has five children. Annilyn is married and has four children presently in school.

Annilyn is in the agricultural business, farming fruits in the Philippines. Annilyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Annilyn has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies to grow more fruit

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 31 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Mary Ann has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers and save for her kids college tuition

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 55 years old and married with six children.

Alejandra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, beverages, and other groceries.

Alejandra has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Alejandra aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her grand children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell, to help send her grandchildren to college

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 48 years old, married with one child.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like eggs, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Gemma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like eggs, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 36 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Rodelyn is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her ducks.

She has been raising ducks for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rodelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her ducks.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 45 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom attends school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Emelda requested her third loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 59 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal and dried coconut meat in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried coconut meat and charcoal.

Luzviminda has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal and dried coconut meat for one year and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried coconut meat and charcoal

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
