Leticia is 51 years old, widowed, and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them. Leticia operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Leticia requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as candies, condiments, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase candies, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Ebelit

texts.en:
Ebelit is married and works hard to support his family. She operates a fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns additional income fishing.

Ebelit requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jeany

texts.en:
Jeany is 37 years old, married and has one child who attends school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Jeany requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell like soap, milk, coffee, chips, eggs, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs. Editha dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy inventory like soap, milk, coffee, chips, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Inelyn

texts.en:
Inelyn is 47 years old, married with three children.

Inelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, sugar and personal care products.

Inelyn has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Inelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, sugar and personal care products

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet owns and has run a beauty salon shop for the last three years. She loves beautifying ladies. She was born in Kasese, Uganda. She is 32 years of age, single, and charged with a responsibility of taking care of two children. 

She is faced with the challenge of market competition and is limited by capital constraints in buying enough of the stock that her customers keep demanding. Her biggest dream is customer satisfaction. 

Janet is in need of a loan to buy cosmetics and braids to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and braids to use in her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and salt for selling

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with one child who is still too young to attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food stuffs.

She has operated fresh juice selling business for the past six months  selling from home to her neighbors and at the market too. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan she wants to purchase  fruits, sugar and juice flavors to use in making the fresh juice .She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, sugar and juice flavors for her fresh fruit juice business

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business, which earns her another source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbors. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her business

loans.name: Aitbubu

texts.ru: Айтбубу, 63 года, вдова, есть сын. Айтбубу на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством, стартовав в 1994 году, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Айтбубу, на сегодняшний день у нее есть корова, 40 овец, на 2,35 Га земли выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средст в не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Айтбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для закупки 8 овец и корма для скота. Айтбубу намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en: Aitbubu is 63 years old, widowed, and has a son. She is retired. As a main source of income she does farm work, having launched this business in 1994. Thanks to Aitbubu’s perseverance, dedication and hard work, at present she owns one cow and 40 sheep; she also grows beans on a field of 2.35 ha [5.8 acres]. Her monthly revenue reaches up to 10,000 KGS. This is insufficient for a dignified existence, which is huy Aitbubu has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy eight seep and animal feed. Aitbubu intends to expand her business, which certainly will lead to improving her   finances.

loans.use: to buy 8 sheep and feed for livestock in order to help bolster her income.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира, 33 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Назиры среднее образование, работает в гостинице, также, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2001 году. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем до 12,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 17 коров, 3 овцы, также она выращивает люцерну для внутрихозяйственного потребления. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 26,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nazira is 33 and married with two children. She has a high school education and works in a hotel. She also works in animal husbandry and agriculture as an additional source of income for her family, a business she started in 2001. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a monthly income of about 12,000 KGS and has 17 cows and three sheep on her farm, and grows alfalfa for her own use. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Nazira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 26,000 KGS to purchase sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business so that she can save toward home renovations.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre trabajador y humilde, cualidades que tiene muy bien merecidas ya que su labor de zapatero le han dado la oportunidad de conseguir el sustento para su familia.

Inicio este negocio hace 45 años a través de las enseñanzas de su padre quien le ofreció la oportunidad de aprender el oficio.

Hoy en día trabaja en la calle con unos ingresos bajos pero ganados con mucho esfuerzo.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar materia prima como cuero, pega, clavos, entre otros, elementos que le permitirán abastecer su negocio y poder generar una mejor producción de calzado.

Ayuda a Luis a cumplir su sueño de comprar una vivienda propia a través de su trabajo!
texts.en:
Luis is a hard-working and humble man, qualities that are very well deserved since work as a cobbler has given him the opportunity to get sustenance for his family. 

He began this business 45 years ago through the instruction of his father who offered him the opportunity to learn the profession.

These days, he works in the street with low income which is earned with a lot of effort.

He asks for a loan to purchase raw material such as leather, adhesive, nails, and more, items which will allow him to stock up his business and be able to generate a better production of shoes.

Help Luis achieve his dream of purchasing his own house through his work!

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as leather, adhesive, nails and more, items that will permit him to stock up his business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim lives with his mother in the north of Jordan.  He is example of an ambitious and positive guy.  Ibrahim is 24 years old, a university student majoring in applied arts and he did not find a suitable work beside his education.
 
He wishes to graduate to find good work to help his mother with household expenses and to carry responsible from her.  Lately his mother faced financial problems and she could not cover Ibrahim`s university fees, therefore he decided to apply for an educational loan to pay for his university fees and achieve his goals.

loans.use: with an educational loan to pay for his university fees, to graduate with a degree in Applied Arts.

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is 37 years old, married, and has two children. He was never able to complete his education due to a lack of financial support from his father. Instead, he was forced to work to support his family but he has had a dream to study law. 

After these years and with support with his wife, Shareef decided to complete his education and achieve his dream to become a successful lawyer, but because of the financial problems he requested an education loan to pay the university fees and start the road to reach his goals. With a combination of optimism and determination, Shareef was able to turn his dreams into reality.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is 27 years old and is in his last year of studying finance in the university. He chose this major because he wants to find good work as soon as possible.

Anas is delaying his last year and graduation because of the financial problems that his family has faced. He requested an educational loan to cover the tuition fees so that he can complete his education and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to cover tuition fees

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
Noél, de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a atender un cafetín en el instituto de la comunidad, vive junto a su pareja y su hijo.

Noél, trabaja en una gasolinera cercana a su comunidad desde hacer 10 años, pero también hace un año inició a comercializar huevos, esta actividad la realiza en los turnos de tarde, es decir en su tiempo libre.- Su trabajo consiste en andar comprando huevos en las granjas y posteriormente los vende casa por casa, movilizándose en un vehículo que acaba de adquirir.

El préstamo solicitado es para reparar el vehículo que utiliza para salir a vender los huevos, porque está en mal estado por ser un carro viejo; él espera solucionar este problema, para continuar vendiendo huevos, para adquirir ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Noel, sueña con tener un negocio estable de comercio de huevos, con el que pueda sostener a su familia sin necesidad de depender de su empleo.
texts.en:
Noél is 40 years old and has a sixth-grade education. He is married and his wife works in the cafeteria of an institution in the community. He lives with his wife and their son.

For ten years, Noél has worked in a gas station close to his community, but one year ago, he also started selling eggs. He carries out this activity in the afternoon (i.e., in his free time). His work consists of first going around to farms to buy eggs and later selling them door to door, traveling in a vehicle that he recently acquired.

The requested loan is to repair the vehicle that he uses to go out selling eggs; it is in bad condition because it is an old car. He hopes to solve this problem in order to continue selling eggs so that he can acquire additional income for his family.

Noél dreams of having a stable egg-selling business with which he can sustain his family without having to depend on his job.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle that he uses to go out selling eggs

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta de 53 años de edad, es una mujer originaria de la zona rural y tiene 4 hijos.

Berta tiene más de 20 años en la actividad de siembra de granos básicos, ya que es parte del sustento de su familia, sus hijos le ayudan siempre que pueden de modo que trabajan en equipo para poder superarse.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos como abonos, semillas, venenos, fertilizantes, etc. Para sus cultivos.
 
Ella sueña con ser una de las productoras de granos básicos más fuertes de la zona y heredarles su experiencia a sus hijos ya que considera que la agricultura es un patrimonio cultural.
texts.en:
Berta is 53 years old. She is a native of the rural area and has four children.

Berta has grown staple crops for twenty years; it is part of her family's sustenance. Her children always help her when they can to get ahead by working as a team. She needs the loan to buy supplies like soil amendments, seeds, pesticides, fertilizers, etc., for her crops.

She dreams of being one of the strongest producers of staple crops in the area and of passing down her experience to her children, as she considers agriculture to be their cultural heritage.

loans.use: to buy supplies like soil amendments, seeds, pesticides, fertilizers, etc., for her crops.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa de 43 años de edad, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, vive con 4 de sus hijos hijos los cuales dependen de ella.

Teresa tiene una tienda, todos sus vecinos llegan a comprar de sus productos a dicho lugar, ya tiene algunos años con este negocio y se siente alegre pues le ha ido muy bien.
 

Ella necesita mucho de este crédito para comprar más productos como arroz, azúcar, consomés, café, leche, golosinas, bebidas, etc. para surtir su tienda.


Ella sueña con que sus hijos estudien y terminen la escuela y pongan en práctica los buenos valores siendo personas honradas.
texts.en:
Teresa is 43 years old, married, and her husband is a farmer. She lives with 4 of her children who depend on her.

Teresa has a store; all of her neighbors come to purchase their products in this place. It has been some years that she has had this business and she is happy because it has gone well.

She really needs this loan to purchase more products such as rice, sugar, broth, coffee, milk, candies, drinks., etc. to stock her store.

She dreams that her children will study and finish their schooling and put into practice the good values of honest people.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as rice, sugar, broth, coffee, milk, candies, drinks, etc. to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Leandro

texts.es: José, tiene 31 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea de la Campa, Lempira. Trabajó por varios años como jornalero y hace 9 años el ha logrado tener su propio cultivo de café. Ahora saca sus cosechas y las vende en el mercado local para obtener ingresos. el cultivo lo tiene en una aldea cercana donde vive. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el tercer ciclo en la institución y es por 20,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a la finca de café. Su objetivo es poder sacar mejor producción para la venta. Con las ganancias piensa hacerle mejoras a su vivienda y sembrar café en otra área de terreno.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old, is married, has five children and lives in a town in Lempira.  He worked for many years as a laborer and nine years ago he managed to harvest his own crop of coffee.

Now he harvests his crops and sells them at the local market for income.  He has his crops at a nearby town.  

The loan that he is requesting is the third cycle in the institution and is for $925.  He will use it to purchase fertilizer for farm maintenance.  His objective to to be able to get better results from the plants and sell more.  With his earnings he plans to improve his home and plant coffee in other terrain.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to aid his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Yuon's Group

texts.en:
Yuon is a married mother of six children living in the Battambang province. She is a rice farmer and a paid worker. She can earn 31,800 KHR per day for support her family. 

Due to lack of funds, she’s now applying for a loan in order to buy seeds and pay plowing fees. She hopes to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар молодая женщина в возрасте 34 лет проживающая в сельской местности. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Муж Нилуфар работает в кирпичном заводе машинистом. Дети учатся в школе. Сама Нилуфар имеет небольшой швейный цех где работают ее сестра и она сама. Она покупает материалы и вышивает из них платья и костюмы для дальнейшей продажи. Так как у Нилуфар бизнес продвигался не плохо она решила воплотить свою мечту и начать строительство нового дома. На данный момент она закончила строительство нового дома и осталось купить и установить окна и двери из пластика. Сейчас у Нилуфар возникли некоторые трудности с финансами и что бы купить окна и двери ей необходима поддержка. С этой проблемой она обратилась в "АРВАНД" и надеется получить кредит. На полученные деньги она хочет купить и установить окна и двери из пластика.
texts.en: Nilufar is a young 34-year-old woman living in a rural area. She is married and has three children. Nilufar's husand works as a machinist in a brick factory. Her children go to school. Nilufar herself has a small sewing workshop where she and her sister work. She buys materials and sews dresses and suits from them for sale. Since Nilufar's business has progressed well, she decided to fulfill her dream and begin building a new house. At the moment she has finished building the house and still has to buy and install plastic windows and doors. Nilufar now has some financial difficulties and she needs support to buy the windows and doors. She has come to Arvand with this problem, and hopes to receive a loan. She wants to buy and install plastic windows and doors with the money she receives.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married and she is runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.  Her husband is a farmer.

Natalia is taking a loan of $600.00 USD to improve her business.

She will use the loan to buy inventory for her store such as coffee, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits, shampoo, and water.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00. 

Natalia is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

She is happy with this loan because it will help her improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits, shampoo, and water

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel es un pequeño productor de café de la zona Norte de Nicaragua. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su finca de 3.5 hectáreas. El café es la principal fuente de ingresos de esta familia, por lo que su meta es incrementar los rendimientos productivos de su plantación de café para mejorar sus condiciones económicas.

Para este ciclo, Migue Ángel se ha propuesto enfrentar los problemas de plagas y enfermedades que afectan el café, mediante la aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su plantación, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento.

Él está seguro que con la disposición de recursos, su trabajo y el acompañamiento técnico que le brinda la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), podrá alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a small coffee producer in the northern part of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and 3 children in his 3.5 hectare farm. Coffee is the main source of income for this family, therefore, his goal is to increase the coffee production to improve his financial situation.

For this season, Miguel Angel’s goal is to deal with the pest problem and plant diseases that are affecting the coffee plantation by applying the necessary supplies and fertilizers. This is the reason he is requesting this loan. He is sure that with the resources available, his work and the technical support that he receives from the “Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC)” association, he will be able to reach his goal.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers to help deal with the pest and plant diseases of his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: IMELDA: Es una señora cordial de 45 años de edad, originaria de Waspam-Rio Coco. Madre soltera de 3 hijos: 1 mayor de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su carrera universitaria y secundaria. Trabaja como enfermera. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de minifalda (Concreto y Madera). Con el préstamo va comprar cemento, bloque y hierro. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Imelda is a friendly woman who is 45 years of age and originally from Waspam-Rio Coco. She is a single mother with three children, an adult child and two teenagers who are studying for their university and high school diplomas respectively. Imelda works as a nurse.

In order to provide her children with a decent and secure home, Imelda is requesting a loan so that she can begin construction of a “minifalda” house [a wooden house with a concrete base]. The loan will be used to buy cement, blocks, and iron. She dreams of having a beautiful house with better and safer conditions so that her children can live in a good environment.

loans.use: to buy materials so that she begin the construction of her house.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es:
Don Ulises tiene  la edad de 41 años, su labor es notificar sobre citas a personas en el sector estatal, junto a su esposa procreo un hijo que estudia en la primaria y es su razón de ser. 

Su primer crédito que Afodenic le emitió fue para cubrir gastos de transporte, gastos personales y gastos Universitarios sobre un post Grado que cursaba en la Ciudad de Juigalpa, tenía que viajar todos los sábados y le fue de gran utilidad en ese momento.

Este crédito lo necesita para  instalar inodoro en su vivienda, ya que solo tiene algunas mejoras como lavamano y por carecer de sumidero no había instalado el servicio higiénico, usaba su letrina, pero ahora ha pensado remodelar la letrina y utilizarla para sumidero e instalar el inodoro así ahorra gastos y tiene mejores condiciones en su hogar sobre todo higiene que es muy importante. 

Opina continuar trabajando con créditos para realizar otras mejoras que amerite la vivienda hasta verla cien por ciento terminada.
texts.en:
Don Ulises is 41 years old, he has an administrative job within the public sector. He and his wife have a son in elementary school who is his reason for living. His first loan from Afodenic was to cover transportation costs, personal expenses and tuition costs for a post graduate course in the city of Juigalpa. He had to travel every Saturday and the loan was of great assistance during this time. 

He needs this loan to install a toilet in his home. Since he only has a few improvements like a washbasin and since he lacked a sink and plumbing he used the latrine. But now he wants to remodel his latrine by installing a toilet and sink and have better conditions in his home as hygiene is of the utmost importance. He would continue working with loans to achieve other improvements that his home warrants until it is 100% completed.

loans.use: to improve the bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Это молодой человек Улугбек. Он 28 летный житель района Восеъ.  Улугбек женат и отец двоих детей. Сыну 1 лет, а дочке 5 месяцев. Дети еще маленькие. Улугбек на районе живет вместе папой, мамой, женой и детьми. Его семья на районе занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Улугбек в средней школе работает учителем. Он свободное время работает на земле. Улугбек вместе семьей выращивает картофель. В этой деятельностью ему нравится получить богатый урожай. Данный момент Улугбек закончил посев и ему надо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить качественный и богатый урожай. Для купли минеральных удобрений у него не хватает денежных средств, и он обратился за кредитом. Улугбек и его семья надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This young man is Ulugbek. He is a 28-year-old resident of the Vose region. Ulugbek is married and the father of two children. His son is one year old, and his daughter is 5 months. His children are still small. Ulugbek lives with his father, mother, wife and children. His family are farmers. Ulugbek works as a teacher in a secondary school. He works on the land in his free time. Ulugbek and his family grow potatoes. What he likes about this activity is getting a rich harvest. At the moment Ulugbek has finished sowing and he needs to treat the soil with artificial fertilizer in order to get a good quality and rich harvest. He does not have enough money to buy the artificial fertilizer, and he has applied for a loan. Ulugbek and his family hope for your support.

loans.use: to buy artificial fertilizer and treat his land with it.

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.es:
Nehemías, de 40 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador y dispuesto  a luchar por su familia.  Su esposa esta al cuido de su pequeño quien estudia primaria en una escuela pública, labora en el sector público desde hace 24 años, impartiendo clases a alumnos de secundaria.

Cuenta con su vivienda donde habita y a base de créditos ha logrado mejorarla; el crédito anterior fue invertido en  construcción de una habitación hoy en día  goza su familia y el gozan de mas espacio y privacidad.

Actualmente  Don Nehemías tiene la necesidad de construir un sumidero en la parte de atrás de su vivienda y así tener más higiene que es su principal propósito en este momento. El dispone de piedras canteras y algún  pero le falta limpiar el terreno, comprar cemento, hierro, arena, y inodoro tubos y otros materiales que utilizara en su mejora.  Solicita este crédito para cumplir su proyecto y contar con un ambiente habitacional saludable y cómodo.

Su propósito siempre es luchar para continuar mejorando su vivienda que será el patrimonio de sus hijos-
texts.en:
Nehemías, is a 40 year old man who is very hard working and ready to fight for his family.  His wife takes care of their child who studies at the public primary school.  He has worked in the public sector for 24 years teaching classes to high school students.  

He depends on his home and through loans he has been able to improve it.  The prior loan was invested in construction of a room that his family now enjoys as it gives them more space and privacy.  

Don Nehemías needs to construct a drain in the rear section of his home to improve hygiene, which is his main goal at the moment.  He has quarry rocks but he needs to clear the land, purchase cement, iron, sand and plumbing pipes and other materials that he will use in his upgrade.  

He is asking for this loan to complete his project and have a comfortable, sanitary, livable space.  His purpose is always to continue improving his home which will be an asset for his children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make a drain.

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina raises and sells pigs. She has been engaged in a pig raising business for 6 years now.  She is 56-year-old single woman, residing in the town of  Talibon, Bohol. She faces financial shortage to finance her livelihood. 

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed. These will truly improve the way she raises pigs. She could now sell quality pigs in a few months to come. Thus, she augments her business and starts to settle her finances.

She hopes that she could expand her existing business to be able to help the schooling of a close relative to have brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed and to help a close relative pay for schooling

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1964 and she is living in village with her family. She is married and does business with a vineyard. She is honest, responsible and goal oriented person. 

The business that she does is interesting and enjoyable for her. She has permanent clients within and abroad from Tajikistan. She gently takes care of her vineyard and needs each time to fertilize her vineyard, in order that it is not destroyed by weeds. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and pay for her rented vineyard. She hopes to be supported and have a good harvest this season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for her rented vineyard, to ensure a good harvest this season

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 50 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. She works hard to show her determination of being able to improve her family’s standard of living. She started her own job by opening her bakery since eight years ago where she produces breads. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase her shop inventory such as flour, oil... She states that the loan will surely help her to extend her job and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to improve her work.

loans.use: to increase her bakery shop inventory

loans.name: Piñafrancia

texts.en:
Piñafrancia, 62, hails in Talibon , Bohol. She is a married with seven children and her youngest child is 15.  She raises and sells hogs as her main source of income.  She has been in the piggery business for 5 years now.

She is asking for a loan to purchase piglets and feeds. These will enhance the way she raises hogs. She will be able to sell quality pigs in few months to come. Thus, her income will improve and she will start to manage her earnings.
 
Her goal is to augment her income and able to handle it properly for sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds for her sustainable living

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a dealer of both Personal Collection and Avon products. She sells items like soap powder, lotion, body spray, cologne, and beauty products. She is 28-year-old single mother of two kids living in Talibon, Bohol. For almost a year she has engaged in this kind of business.

She is asking for a loan to purchase Personal Collection products. With the funds, she could purchase a variety of stock to be delivered to her respective customers. Slowly, her income will be augmented and she will able to pay her obligations. She could also afford to buy her children with good food.

Rosalie is determined to expand her business to support the needs of her children and to be sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase Personal Collection products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more poultry feed to sell for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a fisherman. He sells fish to earn for a living. It has been 8 years now that he has engaged in fishing. 
He is married with four young dependents. He lives in Talibon, Bohol. He decided to take a loan to continue his livelihood.

He is asking for a loan to buy tools like a flashlight, mask, batteries and fuel (for his motor banca).  With these, it will boost his ongoing catch and enable him to improve his earnings. Thus, he could now start to expand his fishing business.

Noel is very happy for the available funds, and he is dedicated to improve his business for the welfare of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools  like flashlight, mask, batteries and fuel (for a motor banca)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for top dressing her plants in her farm for a better harvest and meet the demands of clients and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sugarcane machine for cutting canes for sale in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing his plants on his farm for a better harvest, and meet the demands of clients and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing his plants on his farm for a better harvest and to help educate his children

loans.name: Ma. Mariel

texts.en:
Ma. Mariel is 24 years old and is a married woman.

Ma. Mariel is in the agricultural business farming seaweeds in the Philippines. Ma. Mariel requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and tools.

Ma. Mariel has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ma. Mariel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and tools for her seaweed farm business

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling cashew nuts in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. Estelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional cashew nuts to sell.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 32 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Shiela works very hard to provide for the family.

Shiela runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products, home care products and other groceries.

Shiela has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Shiela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Ligaya requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase thread, cloth, linens, needles and zippers and to pay for maintenance for her tailoring machine.

Ligaya has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase thread, cloth, linens, needles and zippers and pay for maintenance for her tailoring machine.

loans.name: Tinikalca

texts.en:
Tinikalca works hard to support her family. Tinikalca is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Tinikalca requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials such as lines, cloth, thread, needles and maintenance for her tailoring machine.

Tinikalca has been in this business for 30 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as lines, cloth, thread, needles and maintenance for her tailoring machine

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old, married and has four children.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like salt, sugar, etc. for her food vending business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like salt, sugar, etc. to help fund her children going to college

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 49 years old, married with one children.

Celia works hard to provide for her family. Sh,e runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products.

Celia has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from house rental.

Celia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional box of herbal medicine to sell for her buy and sell herbal medecine business.

Norma has been in this business for 3 years. Norma earns more income from raising pigs.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional box of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 38 years old, married and has one child in school.

Leticia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leticia has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leticia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nimfa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising goats. Nimfa is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 55 years old and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. Vilma is married.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Vilma has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 44 years old and widowed with nine children. With three children in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell items like condiments, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries.

Nenita has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, dish washing liquid, condiments, vinegar, etc.. 

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, personal product care, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 48 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Theresa has been raising pigs for twenty years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and married with ten children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Nenita has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Nenita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es: Keylin es una integrante del Banco Mujer Las Hormiguitas, la cual cumple la función de tesorera. Es una joven con 24 años de edad, casada y con 3 hijos. Una hija cursa la primaria y los otros dos son menores de 4 años. Viven en un asentamiento llamado Monterrey en una comunidad rural de Cariari, en donde una institución del gobierno (IDA)les otorgó una parcela. Ahí mismo ella engorda ganado y luego lo vende en la subasta. Inició su actividad productiva con la finalidad de generar ingresos al hogar sin descuidar a su familia. Ella actualmente estudia. Trabajadora y con deseos de superación personal y a nivel de negocio. Han obtenido varios créditos con la Fundación. Éste grupo está compuesto por Keylin y 3 socias más, las cuales van a invertir en actividades como cría de ganado y cerdos. Todas buscan los mismos objetivos "mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias".
texts.en:
Keylin is a member of the women’s bank named “Las Hormiguitas” (The Little Ants) and also serves as its treasurer. She is a young woman who is 24 years of age, married, and has three children. Her daughter is in primary school and the other two children are four years of age. Keylin and her family live in the settlement of Monterrey, a rural community in Cariari where the government institution named IDA gave them a plot of land. There she raises livestock before selling them at auction. Keylin started this productive business so that she could generate household income without having to neglect her family. She is currently a student as well as a hard worker who want to succeed on a personal level and at her business. Keylin has received several loans through Fundación Mujer.

This group includes Keylin and three other members who want to invest in their businesses, such as raising cattle and pigs. All of them have the same goal of improving the living conditions for themselves and their families.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Senny

texts.en:
Senny is 59 years old, married and has ten children.

Senny is in the agricultural business, farming fruits in the Philippines. Senny requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Senny has been in this business for 18 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Wilmar

texts.es: Wilmar de 38 años de edad, proveniente del departamento de Bolívar, llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla con el propósito de encontrar nuevos horizontes.  Fue empleado en un almacén como vendedor, sin embargo éste forastero tan solo duro tres años laborando, puesto que decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio;  visionó que una forma de llegar a cada uno de los hogares de esta ciudad y comercializar electrodomésticos como abanicos, licuadoras, planchas, televisores, equipos de sonido y mecedoras de madera,  sería  ofreciéndoles directamente a las amas de casa en sus hogares,  con la confianza de que éstos productos que son de muy frecuente uso  podrían ser adquiridos mediante facilidad de pago.  La comercialización la realiza en los diferentes barrios de la ciudad de lunes a sábado en el horario de 8 a.m. a  6 p.m.,  sus compras las realiza de contado por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para cumplir con unos pedidos que le han solicitado como abanicos, licuadoras y equipos de sonido.  Wilmar es padre de dos hijos de 7 y 6 años y dos hijas de 4 y 2 años de edad, su meta familiar es hacerle mejoras a su casa y en su negocio ampliar la cobertura a los municipios del Atlántico.
texts.en: Wilmar, 38 years old, from Bolívar department, arrived in the city of Barranquilla with the goal of finding new horizons. He was employed in a store as a salesperson, however this outsider only lasted three hard years working, then he decided to become independent and open his own business.  He envisioned that a way to get to each of the homes in this city and sell household appliances such as fans, blenders, irons, televisions, sound systems and wooden rocking chairs would be offering them directly to the housewives in their homes. With the confidence that these products are used frequently, they could be acquired through the ease of payments. The sales are done in different neighborhoods in the city from Monday to Saturday on the schedule of 8 am to 6 pm.  He makes his purchases in cash, so he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to fill some orders that have been made such as fans, blenders and sound systems. Wilmar is the father of two sons, ages 7 and 6, and two daughters ages 4 and 2. His family goal is to make improvements to his house and in his business to expand his coverage to the municipalities in the Atlántico department.

loans.use: to fill orders that have been made such as fans, blenders, and sound systems.

loans.name: Eliab

texts.en:
Eliab is a 44-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Twenty-two years ago, he invested in an events management business, providing services like renting out tents, chairs and bridal wear to mention but a few. 

Using the proceeds, he has been able to provide basic needs for his family. He has also managed to start up a textile shop alongside farming to earn a daily income. His greatest desire is to venture into modern agriculture and to complete building a permanent house for a residence.

Eliab intends to use the loan to buy cement and sand to plaster his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster his house.

loans.name: Felex

texts.en:
Felex used his previous loan to buy more cattle for the farm. He is a 48-year-old hardworking married man with three children ages 10, 4, and 2 years old; they are living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He still deals in livestock as his main source of income, though he also practices farming to earn an extra income. He started this business with the intention of earning a living and improving his standard of living. Felex hopes to expand his businesses and have a modern farm, though he still faces challenges of pests and diseases, and lack of capital to meet the increasing demands.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for the farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for the farm.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat for her food business

loans.name: Mwatsefu

texts.en:
Mwatsefu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past two years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats to slaughter and get meat for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 38 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Венеры среднее образование, 20 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Венеры, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 1,0 ГА собственного земельного надела, где она ежегодно выращивает фасоль для реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть корова, 2 лошади и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для покупки скота с целью дальнейшего разведения и реализации. Венера намерена развить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en: Venera is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Venera has a secondary education, and for 20 years she has grown crops and raised animals. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, today Venera has 1.0 hectares of her own land where every year she grows beans for sale. She also has a cow, two horses and 20 sheep. The monthly income from the farming business is 11,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Venera has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock to further breeding and sale. Venera intends to develop her business, which will inevitably lead to an increase in her family's capital.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es:
Nubia, a sus 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre en el municipio de El Bagre, inicio una tienda de abarrotes hace un tiempo impulsada por la necesidad económica
Allí trabaja sola todos los días, logrando generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

Su tenacidad, visión, perseverancia y optimismo le han permitido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con la gran cantidad de competidores que existen en el sector; sin embargo, ha sabido manejar la situación y ha aprovechado la ventaja de que el establecimiento ya cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en el mercado.

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor Como granos, Bebidas, dulces, entre otros, así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda. 

Nubia, con el sueño de ampliar su negocio, se visualiza en el momento que el establecimiento esté bien posicionado en el mercado y así poder acreditarlo para que crezca y perdure en el tiempo, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nubia, 40, lives in a common-law marriage in the city of El Bagre. She opened a grocery store some time ago, motivated by financial need. She works there alone every day, managing to earn a sufficient income to cover her basic household expenses.

Her tenacity, vision, perseverance and optimism have allowed her to overcome various obstacles which have presented themselves, especially the great number of competitors in the sector. However, she has known how to manage the situation and she has taken advantage of the fact that her establishment has a long trajectory in the marketplace. 

She is currently applying for a loan to buy wholesale stock, such as grains, drinks, and sweets, among others. She will then be able to stock her store enough to satisfy the demand.

With the dream of expanding her business, Nubia envisions her establishment being well-positioned in the marketplace, therefore becoming accredited so it can grow and last a long time, which will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock such as grains, drinks, and sweets, among others.

loans.name: Jaime De Jesus

texts.es:
Jaime se ha dedicado a la carpintería gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando como empleado en algunas carpinterías y ebanisterías donde aprendió a realizar la actividad. 

Jaime al ver que su negocio estaba muy mal remunerado decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller de carpintería donde gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha podido tener una gran cantidad de clientes. 

Trabaja con 1 empleado durante 10 horas todos los días.
Jaime se encuentra casado y es padre de 2 hijos, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de progreso. 

Debido a que tiene dificultades de capital, Jaime ha tenido que rechazar algunos pedidos de sus clientes por la poca capacidad para conseguir las materias primas necesarias. 

Con el ánimo de mejorar esta condición, aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros, para la fabricación de grandes pedidos de sus clientes. 

Aspira que el préstamo le permita elaborar estos pedidos sin que se afecten sus ingresos mensuales. 

Además, el espera que el negocio le genere ingresos con los cuales pueda ofrecerles a su esposa y sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de salir adelante.
texts.en: Jaime has worked in carpentry for most of his life. Since he was very young he started working as an employee in some carpenter shops and furniture production where he learned to do this work. Since Jaime saw that his business was very badly paid, he decided to become independent and open his own carpenter workshop. Thanks to the good quality of his work, he has been able to have a big quantity of customers. He works with an employee for ten hours every day. Jaime is married and has two children, to whom he has always wanted to offer a better quality of life and better opportunities for progress. Since he has had difficulties with capital, Jaime has had to reject some customers' orders because of his little ability to get the needed raw materials. In order to improve this situation, he hopes a loan will give him the possibility to be able to buy raw material such as wood, glue, nails, among other things, for the production of big orders from his customers. He hopes that his loan allows him to produce these orders without affecting his monthly income. Also, he hopes this business generates income so he can offer his wife and two children a better quality of life and more opportunities to move ahead.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as wood, glue, nails, among other things, for the production of big orders from his customers.

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
John es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas e su moto-taxi a través de las veredas del municipio de Cañasgordas posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es casad y sostiene a sus 2 hijos a los cuales siempre ha procurado ofrecerles la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su moto-taxi ya que es su único medio de trabajo.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.

Apoya a John con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
John is a very hardworking, organized man. He makes a living offering transport services to people with his mototaxi through the streets of the municipality of Cañasgordas, allowing the community to move around to the different areas of the municipality.

He is a friendly, helpful and very enterprising man. He is married and provides for his two children, to whom he has always tried to offer the best life possible.

He is applying for a loan to maintain and repair his mototaxi, which is his only source of work.

With this loan, he will be able to improve the conditions of his vehicle and continue offering his services with total security, without putting any of his clients' lives in danger.

Support John with a loan today!

loans.use: to maintain and repair his mototaxi, which is his only source of work.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un padre de 34 años de edad, emprendedor y dinámica. 
Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de pescado, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que le colabora en las mañanas, así ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares y personales durante 5 años que lleva funcionando su negocio. 

El crédito que solicita estará destinado para la compra de un congelador y surtido de pescado al por mayor que le permita aumentar su inventario y por ende intentar asegurar unas buenas ventas.

Luis, con su espíritu de superación y su proyección hacia la consecución de sus objetivos, se traza la meta de ampliar su negocio, para tener la capacidad de atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, mejorando así la rentabilidad del establecimiento para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a father, 34 years old, enterprising and dynamic.  In the spirit of generating income to support his family, he decided to start his own fish selling business.  He depends on his wife's support who helps him in the mornings.  In this way he has been able to cover the family expenses as well as personal expenses over the five years that his business has been operating.

He is asking for the loan to purchase a freezer and an assortment of fish wholesale which would allow him to increase his inventory, as well as guarantee some good sales.  

Luis, with his positive spirit and his plan to fulfill his objectives, has the goal to increase his business and increase his clientele.  This would better the profit of the business which will allow him to attain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and a variety of fish wholesale to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Fakhra

texts.en:
Fakhra is aged 44, mother of two sons and one daughter and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well and his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. 

Due to these good relations, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope the demand. Therefore, Fakhra requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. 

Fakhra thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.  She hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand.  

She thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Rosentina

texts.en:
A $1000.00 is offered to Rosentina to improve her business. She is married and has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as peanuts, pans and buckets. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Rosentina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, pans and buckets, to sell to make her business bigger

loans.name: Teresa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Teresa es una joven trabajadora de 24 años de edad, actualmente está soltera pero tiene un hijo que ya estudia en la escuela, ella y su hijo viven en casa de sus padres pero solamente el niño depende de Teresa.


Teresa trabaja como empleada en una agroservício, ella está en el área de ventas, ya tiene muchos años de trabajar en ese lugar el cual es bastante pesado pues debe presentarse también los fines de semana, pero sigue adelante por ella y su hijo.

Ella necesita el crédito para iniciar su propio negocio de productos orgánicos, cremas orgánicas para el cutis y otros relacionados con la botánica.

Su meta es que el negocio funcione y así cubrir las necesidades de su hijo.
texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking 24-year-old woman. She is currently single, but she has a son who is already in school. She and her son live in her parents' house, but only the child depends on Teresa.

Teresa works as an employee in the sales department of an agricultural service. She has already worked there for several years, which is rather tiresome as she also has to work on the weekends. However, she keeps going for herself and her son.

She needs this loan to start her own business of organic products, organic skin cream, and other products related to plants. 

Her goal is for the business to work and to thereby cover her son's needs.

loans.use: to start her own business of organic products, organic skin cream, and other plant-related products.

loans.name: Veng's Group

texts.en:
Veng is a rural villager, living in Kampong Thom province. She is a mother of three dependent children and a rice farmer for more than five years. 

Due to lack of fund, she is now leading a group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner to buy a decent latrine. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living and all the family’s members have good health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine and thus improve the health of her family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Maria Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora, de 68 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado, está acompañada, tuvo 6 hijos pero solo 2 viven con ella y su pareja.

Pastora, tiene una venta de comida en su casa, sus clientes son personas de distintos lugares, pues su casa se encuentra ubicada en la entrada de la ciudad, tiene 28 años de vender comida, su comida es elaborada de manera artesanal a base de cocina de leña y todas las mañanas se levanta temprano para tener lista la comida al mediodía. 

El préstamo solicitado es para realizarle algunas mejoras a su vivienda, pues se acerca el invierno y necesita estar preparada, de manera que no se mojen sus pertenencias.

Pastora, sueña con seguir trabajando e ir mejorando su casa, de manera que logre pasar feliz sus últimos días de vida, también quiere que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Pastora is 68 years old and studied until the first grade.  She had six children but only two live with her and her husband.  

Pastora sells food from her house.  Her customers are people from many places as her home is located at the entrance to her city.  She has been selling food for 28 years.  Her food is home made over a wood fire.  Every morning she gets up early to have the mid day meal ready.  

The loan she requests is to complete some improvements to her home.  Winter is coming and she needs to prepare so that her belongings don't get wet.  Pastora dreams of continuing to work and improving her home so that she can spend her last days of life happily.  She also wants her children to succeed and to become professionals.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Alh. Salisu

texts.en:
Alh. Salisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Mayere Kwalo Vilage. 

He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields from his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Alh. Salisu farmer no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alh. Salisu will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, increasing his net income considerably. With increased yields and income, Alh.Salisu has grand plans to grow his farm and acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that will increase his farm's yields

loans.name: Joel Salatiel

texts.es:
Joel es un joven de 23 años, estudiante universitario y caficultor. Este joven es un pequeño emprendedor de una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Dada su formación y su espíritu de superación, este joven se ha integrado a la red de jóvenes empresarios rurales que promueve la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), por medio de la cual se forman capacidades locales y se apoyan a los pequeños productores en la implementación de buenas prácticas.

Para mejorar sus ingresos de la producción de café, Joel está solicitando su primer financiamiento para la adquisición de insumos agrícolas que le ayuden a mejorar la productividad de su pequeña finca de 1.4 hectáreas y con ello tener mayores ingresos, con los cuales planea continuar manteniendo sus estudios en la universidad.
texts.en:
Joel is a 23 year old young man, university student and coffee farmer.  This young man is an enterprising member of a rural community in northern Nicaragua.  Given his training and his spirit of self improvement, he has become a member of a group of young, enterprising people in rural areas which promotes the association of Towns in Community Action (PAC).   Through this organization they form local groups and they support the local small businesses.

To better his coffee income Joel is asking for his first loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies which will help him increase productivity on his small farm of over three acres.  This should yield more income with which he plans to continue his studies at the university.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies which will help him to have a better coffee crop and be able to continue studying because of that income.

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: A 42 ans, Dopé  est une femme mariée et vit avec deux enfants à Adamavo. Bien consciente de son état elle vend des produits d’alimentations génarales dans son quartier afin de générer un bénéfice pouvant couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Dopé  achète son stock auprès de ses fournisseurs quatre fois par mois et en tire assez de profits. Dopé désire ce crédit pour commander des légumes, des tomates et des oignons afin de trouver son bénéfice pour subvenir favorablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Dope is a 42-year old, married woman who lives with two children in Adamavo. Very aware of her condition, she sells groceries in her neighborhood in order to earn a profit that can cover her daily expenses.  Dope buys her inventory from her vendors four times per month and earns enough profit from that.  Dope would like this loan to buy vegetables, tomatoes, and onions, in order to make a profit to successfully meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 1 pile of vegetables, 1 basket of tomatoes, and two piles of onions.

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en: Nhan’s group live in a rural village, in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nhan makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aim's Group

texts.en:
Aim’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Aim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mhelrose

texts.en:
Mhelrose is 27 years old and married with two children. With one of her children in school, Mhelrose works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, spices, milk, drinks, etc.

Mhelrose has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, spices, milk, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 59 years old and widowed with one child. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Elena has been in this business for 21 years and sells a variety of items such as canton, canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, beverages, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase  a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, beams, roofing fasteners and wire to change the roofing of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to put in a sewer.

loans.name: Rozahan

texts.ru: Розахан, 25 лет, замужем, детей нет. У Розахан- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством, выращивая картофель, пшеницу и ячмень на 1,50  ГА собственной и 2,0 ГА арендованной земли. В хозяйстве есть 14 коров, 40 овец. Продукция пользуется большим спросом, поэтому Розахан решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошадей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Розахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, и планирует накопить на постройку дома.
texts.en:
Rozahan is 25 years old, married and childless. Rozahan has secondary education. As the main breadwinner for her family she works in crop husbandry, growing potatoes, wheat, and barley on 1.5 hectares of her own land and on 2 hectares of rented land. There are 14 cows and 40 sheep on the farm. 

Her produce enjoys a large demand, thus Rozahan has decided to apply to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy horses in order to increase her livestock headcount. Rozahan plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, and also plans to save up to build a house.

loans.use: to buy some horses in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira is a goal-oriented woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1987 and now lives in the village of Shahrituz with her family. She is married and has three children.

Nodira needs to work hard to feed her family but enjoys it. She farms in her yard and sells her produce to a steady clientele in the marketplace. She also keeps livestock so as to bring in additional income.

Now Nodira is applying for a 15,000 TJS loan through Kiva’s partner IMON to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant for the upcoming season. She hopes to have a good harvest and profits to apply toward her family’s needs such as food and clothing. She awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nicanora works hard to support her family. She has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 22,500 through NWTF to buy more frozen food to sell through her business. She also earns income from a general store.

Nicanora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 56 years of age and a resident of Dapitan, Philippines. She is married with six children. She and her husband have a little fishing business from which to earn a living for their family. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realize that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Cirila and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. 

They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 7,000 loan. This loan is intended to buy fish nets, foams and other fishing accessories to improve her business. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help and that she is grateful being a member of the financing institution.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, foams and other fishing accessories to improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase the amount of milk he supplies and thereby earn more income.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 58 years old. She is a widow and currently lives in Owawon, Dapitan City with her two children. She is very responsible and hardworking with her household obligations, and she has always been known to provide the best for her family.

For a living, Rosemarie has always been a rice and corn farmer, and she also plants vegetables and grows root crops.

Rosemarie wants to live in a decent house. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase plywood and sticks for the repair of her house. In the future, she deeply hopes to see all her children with stable financial status.

loans.use: to purchase plywood and sticks, for the repair of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for more income gain to help educate his children

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married, and has three kids who all attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated  a poultry farming business which earns her other source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation in her place of operation.

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for her business

loans.name: Mary Joyce Ann

texts.en:
Mary Joyce Ann is 30 years old and single woman.

Mary Joyce Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, etc.

Mary Joyce Ann has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, etc

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Karen works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Karen is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Karen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell and provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Nurzada

texts.ru: Нурзада успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Нурзады на сегодня есть 2 коровы, арендовано 3,50 Га земли, где выращивается фасоль. Ее прибыль составляет 14,700 сом (KGS). Нурзада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения удоя экологически чистого и вкусного молока. Доходы от кредита Нурзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurzada has successfully repaid her loan, and she is thankful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with financing. Presently on Nurzada's farm there are two cows, and 3.5 hectares of rented land on which she cultivates beans. Her profit is 14,700 som (KGS).

Nurzada has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows in order to increase her yield of environmentally friendly and delicious milk. Nurzada plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further expansion of her business.
