loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Mañury Yurley

texts.es:
Mañury es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 6 años. 
Actualmente se gana la vida con la venta de mercancía por lociones, cremas de manos, desodorantes, gel. Entre otros; esta actividad la inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, con este negocio ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su familia. 

Es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante para seguir con su negocio. 

Este crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido de mercancía como perfumería, cremas, entre otros con el fin de tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes que principalmente son amigos y vecinos. 

Su principal sueño es tener gran cantidad de surtido y ampliar la cartera con los clientes buenos y aumentar sus ventas, así podrá tener un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Mañury is a 33 year old woman, she is married and is the mother of a 6 year old son. Currently, she makes a living selling merchandise such as lotions, hand creams, deodorants, gel, among others. She started doing this thanks to the support of a family member. With this business she has been able to obtain revenues to support her family. She is an entrepreneur and a hard working woman who wants to succeed and continue with her business.

The loan she is requesting from the “Corporación Interactuar” is to invest is the purchase of a variety of merchandise such as, perfumes, lotions, among others, to increase her sales by offering a larger selection to satisfy the customer’s preferences and demands. Her customers are mainly friends and neighbors.

Her main dream is to have a large selection of products, expand the good client base and increase her sales to have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase a selection of merchandise, such as perfumes, lotions, among others.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y al cultivo de hortalizas, posee 25 años de experiencia en la actividad, su esposa le ayuda a comercializar sus productos en los diferentes mercados, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra insumo para el cultivo como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plaga, herbicidas, etc. y pago de alquiler de la parcela ya que no cuenta con una propia y así tener mejor ingreso económico para una mejor  calidad de vida.
texts.en: Adrian is 39 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 4 children. He works growing basic grains and vegetables and has 25 years experience in the field. His wife helps him sell his product in the different markets. He is requesting a loan to buy inputs for his crops like fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicide, etc. and pay the rent for the land as he does not yet have his own. Doing this he will obtain higher economic income for a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. and pay rent on the land.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer, age 35, is from Owawon, Dapitan City, Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Jenifer joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. Helping the family survive, she engaged in a barbecue vending business. Fortunately, her stall is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Jenifer keeps on running her business well, for the good of her family. 

Jenifer is now trying to expand her resources, so she needs additional working capital. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy light materials for her business space extension and pay for inventories of chicken and pork meat for her barbecue, in order to continue putting bread and butter on the table in their home. 

With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with a new house in the future.

loans.use: to buy light materials for her business space extension and pay for inventories of chicken and pork meat for her barbecue

loans.name: Ma. Niña

texts.en:
Ma. Niña  is a native from Talibon, Bohol. She is 30, married with two young dependents.  She engages in fresh fish vending business and she sells fish to the locals in her place. It has been 5 years now that she engaged in that kind of business. Aside from that, she also has a food vending business. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase variety of fish, fish foam(storage), and supplies for food vending. These are very essential tools that will help improve her livelihood. With these, she will be able to handle her finances and start to pay her obligations.
 
 Ma. Niña is determined to manage her existing sources of income for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fish, fish foam(storage) and supplies for food vending, for the welfare of her children

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 44-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are still in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jessabel

texts.en:
Jessabel is married and lives with her family in the Philippines. For the past three years she has worked hard earning an income by fishing.

Jessabel has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fishing gear such as nets and pay for gasoline and general maintenance on her boat. She would like to develop and expand her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear and pay for gasoline and general maintenance on her boat.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 39 years old and married with four children. With four children are currently in school, Jemma works very hard to provide for them.

Jemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products.

Jemma has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, 35, lives with her five children and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband drives a rickshaw that he must pay daily rent for and earns a very low income doing so. As his children grow, their needs are growing as well, which has been a great worry for him.

Nasreen had been saving up money so her husband could buy his own rickshaw, but her savings weren’t quite enough to do so. Therefore, she applied for a 50,000 PKR loan for her husband so that together with her savings he could finally buy one. Now the rickshaw rent will no longer be a burden.

NASREEN hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. She is very happy for this loan and gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy a new rickshaw for her husband's business.

loans.name: Bumairam

texts.ru: Бумайрам, 51 год, замужем. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бумайрам занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бумайрам, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть земельный надел размером 0,89 ГА, на котором выращивает пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бумайрам обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для откорма. Доходы от кредита Бумайрам планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Bumairam is 51 years old and married. She has secondary education. As the main breadwinner for her family, Bumairam works in field husbandry and animal husbandry, having started fifteen years ago from the purchase of livestock at 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bumairam's persistent hard work, today on her farm there is an allotment of 0.89 hectares, on which she cultivates wheat. Her monthly income is 8000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Bumairam has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow for fattening up. Bumairam plans to invest the gains from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock animals she has.

loans.use: to buy one cow for fattening

loans.name: Saraa

texts.en:
Saraa is a 22-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children attending school. She cooperates with her husband, who works in the Lebanese army, to improve their lifestyle and to always be able to meet their children’s needs.

Two years ago, she decided to start her own business and opened a shop in her town, where she sells and rents bridal dresses. She is a talented and welcoming person, which has allowed her to gain a good reputation in her town.

Today, she is requesting a loan through Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase her shop inventory and be able to meet her customers' needs, which will in turn enable her to increase her income.

loans.use: to increase her bridal wear shop inventory

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita makes a good living with every quarter of her farm in Dapitan, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. Angelita has been able to provide for their needs, especially her children's education.

Now she wishes to plant vegetables, root crops, and bananas of a good variety so that she can increase her farm's yield. However, Angelita is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings.

Angelita has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase herbicides and insecticides to spray on his farm crops for a better harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides for use in her farm for a high production.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 48 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Erma works very hard to provide for them.

Erma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Erma has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as dried fish, fabric conditioner, shampoo, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Erma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She both catches and sells fish in the Philippines.

Mary Jane has taken out and successfully repaid five previous loans through Kiva’s field partner NWTF. She is now borrowing 20,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. She hopes her hard work will result in enough money to send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
A $600.00 is offered to Petronila to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as shoes, umbrellas, scarves, trousers, shorts, slippers and body lotion. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. 

She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Petronila independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes, umbrellas, scarves, trousers, shorts, slippers and body lotion

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Merlinda is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business, so she will be able to send her kids to college

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, ella no cuenta con ningún nivel académico pues no tenía las facilidades económicas para prepararse.


Maribel lleva un tiempo en realizar ventas de antojitos típicos , negocio que aprendió para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella vende panes, enchiladas, tacos y tamales todos los días de la semana para ganarse el sustento diario.

Ella necesita la ayuda de este crédito para comprar aceite, sal, azúcar, harina, pan, maíz, entre otros para la venta de comida típica.

A futuro ella desea tener un negocio más amplio que  pueda generarles más ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en: Maribel is a 43 year old single mother of three children who are all adults. She has no formal education as she didn't have the economic situation to study. For some time Maribel has been selling traditional food, a business she learned to raise her children. She sells breads, enchiladas, tacos and tamales every day of the week to earn her daily sustenance. She needs the help of this loan to buy oil, salt, sugar, flour, bread and corn amongst others to sell her traditional foods. In the future she wants to have a larger business that can guarantee greater income for her household.

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, sugar, flour, bread and corn amongst others to sell her traditional foods.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Nenita has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Leodilyn

texts.en:
Leodilyn is 31 years old and has three children, who are all in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Leodilyn has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a Babban Gona farmer from Mayere Ranau Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. 

Since joining Babban Gona, Adamu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, increasing his income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona, Adamu now has the chance to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that will increase his farmer yields

loans.name: Kaltoum

texts.en:
Kaltoum is a 45-year-old married woman living with her husband who is the main income provider in the family and four children. She has been working since 2006 from her house selling homemade foods to help her husband financially to meet the family's needs and to improve their lifestyle. 

Kaltoum is requesting her second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve her business merchandise with the aim of increasing her productivity and her income. In the future, she is planning to borrow an additional loan from Kiva to open her own store in her town.

loans.use: to improve her business merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her business by increasing vegetable supplies as well as assorted fruits

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Gina has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, soap powder, coffee, diapers, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and married. Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, personal product care and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as peanuts, bread, biscuits, candies, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Melrose works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Melrose is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like thread, cloth, needles, and maintenance for her tailoring machine.

Melrose has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like thread, cloth, needles, and maintenance for her tailoring machine

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 49 years old now.

Marilyn has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, who lives in Kasese, Uganda, is 31 years old and is married with two children. Samuel has been in the bar business and also owns a motorcycle transport for additional income since 2013, which has enabled him earn a living and support his family. 

Samuel has a dream of expanding his business into a casino hall offering entertainment, which will attract more customers and increase his profits. However, he is faced with the challenge of market competition. Samuel requests a loan facility to buy beers, spirits and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, spirits, and sodas for his bar.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 2 сыновей. У Бурулкан- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 12 овец. На 1,92 Га земли она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Бурулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Burulkan is 54 years old, married, and has raised two sons with her spouse. Burulkan has secondary education. As the main breadwinner for her family, she works in animal husbandry and field husbandry, having started 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Burulkan's persistent hard work, today her farm has a cow and twelve sheep. She cultivates beans on 1.92 hectares of land. Her monthly income is about 14,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Burulkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock in order to increase her herd. Burulkan plans to invest the funds from her loan in the further incerease of the number of livestock animals.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: helps Rukhsana's husband in purchasing milk in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat is a confident woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is a widow and has three children. She has 15 years of experience of doing business. She plants apricots, wheat and rice on her land. It is not enough to do business because the standard of living in her area is less than usual. That is why she needs to work and do business as well. 

She is a teacher in secondary school. She started doing business planting watermelons, but she did not have enough time to continue looking after her harvest. Recently, she decided to plant wheat and rice temporally. 

She requested a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and pay for hired workers. She hopes to have a good harvest and an opportunity to gain more income to make a living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and pay for hired workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools and inputs so as to get a better harvest and meet the demands of clients and his family needs.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a 45-year-old maize farmer from Mayere Ranau Village. Hauwa joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children: Shitu, Zainab, and Ashiru.

In the past, Hauwa suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay her children's school fees. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Hauwa has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize this year, Hauwa can now ensure that her children go to good schools and get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her farm's yields.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is a woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marian is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marian has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Marian has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Cañada Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Cañada Poty se formó en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Cinthia.
Ella se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que quiere capacitarse para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella tiene una heladería, y además vende productos varios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados varios para la venta y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas cunado lo viene haciendo. Cinthia esta agradecida porque el programa de comité de mujeres le está siendo de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The members of the Cañada Poty group, formed in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso, are part of the poverty elimination program. One of the group's members is Cinthia.

Cinthia is notable for being a very hardworking and enterprising person who wants to get training to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. She has an ice cream shop, in addition to selling assorted products. She is grateful for the opportunity to be able to grow her business and come out ahead.

Cinthia requests this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various ice creams she will sell and, with it, be able to continue selling as she is now. She is grateful because the women's program committee is being very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy various ice creams to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 32-year-old married male with five children, of whom four go to school. 

He has been selling clothing for the last fourteen years and does crop growing, mainly coffee and cotton, for additional income. 

Nelson started the business for personal sustainability and hopes to improve his home. 

However, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital that hinders him from satisfying his customers' demands. Nelson intends to use the loan to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing to have a better harvest and to meet the demands of clients and the needs of family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools and inputs for a better harvest to meet the demand of clients and support her family.

loans.name: Noor Robi

texts.en:
Noor Robi is a 23-year-old married woman whose financial condition is not good. Her husband has just started to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that includes a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads for short distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to handle the rough roads. The rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles when driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his moto rickshaw.

Noor Robi has requested a loan for her husband to buy the moto rickshaw body and drive it smoothly. 

Noor Robi thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy her husband a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Tusiime

texts.en:
Tusiime is a 33-year-old male married with 3 children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop with general merchandise. He has been in that business for 10 years. He began the business to raise income for the family; limited capital and price fluctuations are his major challenges.  

Tusiime has a dream of expanding his business and making more profits. Tusiime will use the loan to buy plastic cups, plate, saucepans, cassava flour, rice, sugar and beans to sell. 

The name Tusiime looks like a family name but there is a religion in Uganda that uses surnames only.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, plate, saucepans, cassava flour, rice, sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en: Stanely lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a 32-year-old married and hard-working man. Stanely deals in electronics, selling phones, and supplements his income by selling shoes. He hopes to grow and expand his electronics business but inadequate capital limits his returns. He will use the loan to buy more phones to sell.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell.

loans.name: Cristian Daniel

texts.es:
Cristian es un mecánico de motos y carros muy experimentado. 

Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de las enseñanzas de un amigo y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.

Adicional a su labor como mecánico también ofreces servicio de pintura de motos y carros.

Es un joven muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar un aerógrafo, una fuente de energía y pintura para surtir su taller con estas herramientas y poder prestar un servicio de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Cristian is a very experienced motorcycle and car mechanic. He has acquired many skills taught by a friend and, in addition, he has learned empirically. In addition to his labor as a mechanic, he also offers painting services for motorcycles and cars.

Cristain is a young and honorable worker who understands the significance of automobiles to their owners and it is for this reason that he always tries to offer excellent quality service in an efficient manner.

Cristian is requesting a loan to purchase an airbrush, a source of energy, and paint, to provide his shop with these supplies, and to be able to offer service of a better quality.

loans.use: purchase an airbrush, and a source of energy plus paint, to supply his shop with these inputs, in order to offer a better quality of service.

loans.name: Phillex

texts.en:
Phillex deals in electronics and also does farming, mainly cassava and maize, in Hoima, Uganda. He repairs radios and televisions. He works seven days a week and started business in 2008. He is married with three children, ages 3 to 8. 

He hopes to improve his service to his customers by providing them with a range of different products. High rent is still a hindrance to his business.

Phillex is acquiring credit to buy more spare parts for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his workshop.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, 24-year-old single father of one child who lives in Hoima, Uganda, operates both a salon and a motorcycle transport business to provide income for his family. In order to grow and expand his business, David is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander, de 45 años de edad, esudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tiene un hijo.

Álexander, se dedica a realizar mediciones de terreno desde hace 25 años, este trabajo es mejor conocido como “cadenero”, actualmente ha sido contratado por un ingeniero civil, pues van a construir una lotificación en las afueras de la ciudad.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda, pues se acerca el invierno y quiere estar preparado de tal forma que no le afecte.

Alexander, sueña con ir mejorando su casa, de tal manera que le pueda dar una vida más confortable a su pareja y a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alexander is 45 years old and finished secondary school. He has a partner who takes care of the household chores and a son. Alexander has been a ground surveyor for 25 years.  This type of work is better known as “cadenero” (chainman). Currently he was hired by a civil engineer because they are going to build a sub-division in the outskirts of the city.

The loan requested is to purchase materials to improve his house because winter is near and he wants to be prepared. Alexander dreams of improving his home in order to provide a more comfortable life for his partner and children.

loans.use: to purchase materials to improve his house.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been making embroidery by her own hands at home for many years to support her family. 

For the sake of her children and to meet household expenses, she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all raw materials for making embroidery; she completes her tasks, beside her daughters, over a wooden frame. 

She has become expert in her arts and wants to buy raw material her of own so that she can sell her hand-made embroidery in her hometown. Therefore, Safia has requested a loan to buy raw material so she can make more embroidered dresses to sell and can generate maximum income. 

She is the mother of three daughters and three sons. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
Sabra is 41 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband owns a small firm ithat has a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic bottles. He employs laborers for his molding machines paying them daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic bottles he needs different categories and qualities of raw material. Now he has taken a huge contract, larger than before, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy additional crushed raw material to continue his manufacturing. 

Therefore, Sabra has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy crushed plastic raw material for his molding machine. She has to look after a huge family, taking care of her children, including paying their school fees and providing a good diet and health care. For these purposes she needs a large income and her husband is only one responsible for bearing the household expenses. 

Sabra is very happy receiving this loan and thanks Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase crushed plastic as raw material to manufacture plastic bottles.

loans.name: Bibisitora

texts.en:
Bibisitora is a purposeful woman. She is 64 years old. Bibisitora lives with her family in the district of Shahrituz. She is a very caring mother who tries to provide her children with a good living conditions. 

The purpose of getting a loan is that Bibisitora wants to start a new business in animal husbandry. Previously, she had cattle only for family use but now she wants to start a new business in the field of animal husbandry. 

Her main challenge is that she does not have enough money. For this reason Bibisitora applied for a loan in order to purchase a few heads of small cattle and begin her new business. She is waiting for your support.

loans.use: To start a new business in animal husbandry.

loans.name: Yulduzhon

texts.en: Yulduzhon is a careful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1991. She is single and lives with her mother in a remote district. She is a worker in a government agency. She is honest, responsible, goal-oriented and kind. Her mother got sick and needs to be treated. Yuiduzhon is trying to help her mother but unfortunately, she lacks money for hospital treatment. She wants treatment for her mother and has no father or siblings to offer support in difficult situations. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to provide treatment for her mother in hospital.  She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide treatment for her mother in hospital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna goes fishing. She sells fish to the locals in her place. She is married and has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. She resides in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan of an amount of 25,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, nylon and weights. These tools would enable Myrna and her family improve her on-going catch. With these, she could handle her earnings and pay her obligations. 

She could then start to expand her fishing business to become more sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, nylon and weights.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Shu'aibu

texts.en:
Shu'aibu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Mayere Ranau Village. Shu'aibu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children Christi, Jumai and Serah. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Shu'aibu will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Shu'aibu has set high goals of harvesting 60 bags of maize. With increased yields and incomes, Shu'aibu has made it his ultimate goal to ensure all his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 41-year-old married woman; she is a responsible mother and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is involved in a scrap dealing business and deals with scrap goods such as iron, plastic accessories and waste paper. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have enough money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap even in stock to sell to generate income.

Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase recycled material to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides to spray on her crops on her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools and inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting which will help her to educate her children

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is age 40; she is a mother of four children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc.

He manages his household necessities from his own store, and as well, his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well.

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Shabana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.

Shabana hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. Shabana thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his business by increasing machines and personnel for more income gain.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en:
Gulandom is a wise woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is living in remote district with her family. She is single and has been working almost 23 years. 

She works as a nurse in medical clinic and has many years of practice treating and assisting (helping) doctors. Recently she is sick and needs to be treated in medical clinic. Her salary is not enough to the treatments in hospital. 

She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to get a loan to treat her in medical clinic. She hopes to be treated and able to continue her work helping other people.

loans.use: to receive treatment in a medical clinic

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is widowed with five children, and two children going to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She knits sweaters and table mats and has been in business for 11 years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy thread, needles,material for making clothes. 

She works in the shop six days every week and sells on a retail basis. She gets additional income from rental rooms and poultry farming. Her major business challenges are transportation and defaulters. She aspires to buy an electric sewing machine. 

Nulu resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and material for making clothes, so that one day she may buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh cattle feed.

loans.name: Roetti

texts.en:
Roetti is 52 years old and single with two children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been mining and selling crude salt for ten years now to get income to raise her children. She is faced with the challenge of a lack of protective gear; the government failed to protect the salt miners.

As a loving mother, she has a dream of educating her children, since she never got that chance of going to school.

Roetti is requesting a loan to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all go to school. She has no additional members. 

She sells green bananas at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green banana. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses . She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas for resale, to support her children's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase herbicides and insecticides to spray on his crops for a better harvest on his farm

loans.name: Maricho

texts.en:
Maricho raises and sells hogs to earn a livelihood.  She is a 45-year-old married woman with one grown dependent. 
She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She has not enough capital to support her livelihood.

She has requested a loan to buy pigs and feeds.  These will definitely help improve to raise healthy hogs in the coming months. With these, Maricho will start to augment her income and able to handle her finances. 
 
She is determined to expand her business to become sustainable, and she is willing to help others who are also in need.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feeds to augment her income

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 45 years old and she supports 9 family members. 

She has been a farmer for the last 5 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to purchase farm tools and inputs, so as to get a better harvest and meet the demands of clients and family needs. 

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools and inputs to be to able to educate her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and inputs so as to get a better harvest

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa de 37 años de edad es divorciada vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, posee 6 años de experiencia en dicha actividad, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en graneros para luego comercializarlos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para compra de insumo para cultivo como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. por mayor y tener una mejor cosecha para generar ingresos económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa, 37, is divorced, and lives in her own home with her four children. She makes her living cultivating corn, with which she has 6 years of experience. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in granaries for later sale in and around the area where she lives. With the proceeds from her sales, she manages to meet some household expenses. 

She is applying for a loan in order to purchase agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers, manures, pesticides, herbicides, etc. at wholesale and to improve her harvest and earn income for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, manures, pesticides, herbicides, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Diego Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Diego es un experimentado carpintero el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a la experiencia obtenida trabajando en muchos talleres de maderas y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo.
 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de una circular de banco para cortar madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en sus hijos, puesto que quiere darles una muy buena educación y que en un futuro sean personas muy exitosas.

Siempre pensando en Interactuar como su aliado y compañero en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Diego is an experienced carpenter who learnt his trade a long time ago through working in many woodwork workshops. Over time he became more independent and eventually set up his own workshop which, despite setbacks, has allowed him and his family to get by in life. 

His proudest achievement is having built up a very good reputation for himself thanks to his high-quality work. 

He is asking for a loan to buy a circular table saw to cut wood which will allow him to make more furniture and therefore improve his profits. 

His main dream is to provide his children with a good education so that they might be successful one day. 

He thinks of Interactuar as his ally and partner in his productive process.

loans.use: to buy a circular table saw to cut wood which will allow him to make more furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools and inputs so as to get a better harvest and meet the demands of clients and family needs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a food stall and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bread, biscuits, cooking oil, packets of sweets, chapatti, samosas and donuts. She works in a shop five days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bread, biscuits, cooking oil, packets of sweets and chapatti.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: Zulfiya is a wise woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has one child. She has many years of experience working as a cook in kindergarten. She is interested in agriculture and wants to do business raising livestock. She is planning to have a business in this field to generate income to help improve the budget of her family. She asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy calves. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Sumomei Group

texts.en: The Sumomei Group is made up of four enterprising members, dedicated to working for their families’ well being. They are selling soft drinks, jeans, groceries and sewing accessories. Nana is the group representative. She sells soft drinks (assorted) and started this business eight years ago with the help of a loan she got from her mother, who inspired her success. Since then, Nana has maintained her business. She is asking for a loan to buy assorted soft drinks to sell to customers. One of her goals is to maintain her business. Cliton is another one of the members. He is 20 years old, and he has been selling jeans. Habiba is 44 years old and sells groceries and Beatrice is 57 years old and provides seamstress services.

loans.use: To buy assorted soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase herbicides and insecticides to spray on the crops on his farm for a high production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools and inputs for a better harvest to meet the demand of clients and her family's needs.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, three in school. Janet sells charcoal and has been in this business for 15 years, working six days a week. She sells her products at the market on a retail basis. Janet has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her main business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal is to improve her sales. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more artificial nails, Ponds products, lipstick, wigs, and eyelashes to sell and also serve her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his motorcycle business through servicing and maintenance as well as changing damaged parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and inputs so as to improve her farming activities for high production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his retail business by adding more stock of home products

loans.name: Los Progresistas De Cupiche Group

texts.es: Nélida es socia del grupo  “LOS  PROGRESISTAS DE CUPICHE”. Ella tiene 40 años de edad es soltera con un hijo educando. Ella empezó su negocio de comida hace 10 años. Luego lo implemento con la venta de bebidas. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas insumos aceite arroz azúcar papas y bebidas.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nélida es la primera de lado derecho.
texts.en:
Nélida (first woman from the right) is a member of the group "LOS PROGRESISTAS DE CUPICHE. She is 40 years old, single, and has a son who goes to school. She started her food business 10 years ago. Later she added the sale of beverages. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more supplies, such as oil, rice, sugar, potatoes, and beverages.

The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan offered.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, potatoes, and beverages.

loans.name: Nimet

texts.en:
Nimet is married with four children. She has been selling Tupperware products for nine years. She started off selling only one product, but later talked to her sales rep and decided that she could sell more in order to make some more income for herself and to provide for her children. She says her sales and profits are good. With the loan she will buy more Tupperware products. Her dream is to provide for her children's education.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Nimet Hanım evli ,dört çocuk annesi. Dokuz yıldır Tupperware ürün satışı yapıyor. Bu işe bir ürün alarak başlıyor. Aldığı üründen memnun kalınca ve satış temsilcisi ile konuşduktan sonra kendisi de çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için bu işi yapmaya karar veriyor. Satışlarının ve kazancının çok iyi olduğunu söylüyor. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile mutfak ürünleri alacak. Çocuklarının en üst eğitimlerini alıp okullarını bitirmelerini istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Maria de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de minutas desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como ha logrado salir adelante ella quiere mejorar su vivienda ya que parte de la casa esta hecha de bajareque y quiere ponerle laminas, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, cuartones, clavos y pago de mano de obra asi ella y su esposo puedan tener una mejor vivienda donde puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband. She sells fruit flavored shaved ice for a living and has done so for several years. She has managed to get ahead with what she earns from her work. She wants to improve her home by installing metal sheeting because a part of it is made out of sticks, cane reeds, and mud.

It is for this reason that she requests a loan, so she can purchase metal sheeting, wooden beams, nails, and so she can pay for the labor. This way, she and her husband can have a better home where they can live safely.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wooden beams, nails, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group

texts.en:
Godfrey, who is in his early thirties, is married with two children who are still at school. He has been selling secondhand clothes for one-and-a-half years now. He works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Godfrey's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on buying a better quality and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and for loan repayment; he also built his house, bought a TV set, and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy best-quality secondhand clothes. He dreams of buying the most best-quality secondhand clothes.

Godfrey will share this loan with his loan group Pilika Pilika, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy best-quality secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna is a cheerful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and does business with her mother.

She is new in the sphere of business and does business selling and buying grocery products. She has a small grocery store near her house. Her business is going well. She tries to serve customers gently and with patience. She has permanent customers every day.

She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to buy grocery products for her working capital. She hopes to have a variety of products to sell and have a good income for family needs such as food and clothing.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Juan Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín, de 38 años de edad, es un hombre luchador, fue húerfano, pues su padre los abandonó y su madre murió cuando él tenía solo 2 años de edad, fue criado por una tía, quien no lo dejó que estudiara y lo puso a que trabajara la tierra de sol a sol, actualmente está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, su pareja se dedica al cuido del hogar y atiende un molino al que acuden todas las personas de la comunidad para moler maíz. 

Agustín, es empleado en una hacienda ganadera cercana a su comunidad, ahí desempaña el cargo de sub-capataz y es el encargado de coordinar ciertas actividades que se realizan en la hacienda.- Agustín, también es una persona muy versátil, pues también a trabajado como mecánico, chofer, tractorista, carpintero y soldador, oficios que ha aprendido en el transcurrir de la vida.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz, pues en los ratos libres cuando sale en la tarde del trabajo, aprovecha junto con sus hijos a cultivar maíz para consumir y para vender.

Agustín, sueña con llegar a tener un taller de carpintería y enseñarle a sus hijos, para que se convierta en un negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Agustín, age 38, is a determined man who was orphaned as a child. His father abandoned him and his mother died when he was only two years old. Agustín was raised by an aunt who did not allow him to attend school. Instead, she had him work the soil from sunrise to sunset. Agustín is currently in a relationship and has two children. His partner takes care of their home and operates a grain mill that attracts all of the people in their community who need to grind corn.

Agustín is employed at a cattle ranch near his community where he works as an assistant foreman. He is in charge of coordinating certain activities that take place on the ranch. Agustín is also a very versatile individual. He has worked as a mechanic, a chauffeur, a tractor driver, a carpenter, and a welder. He learned all these trades in order to get through life.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies for planting corn. During his free time, he goes out in the afternoon to do this type of work. He takes advantage of having his children with him so that they can plant corn for consumption and to sell.

Agustín dreams of having a carpentry workshop where he can teach his children and turn it into a family business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for planting corn.

loans.name: Edith Yolanda

texts.es: Edith una mujer trabajadora de 58 años de edad, vive junto a su hija mayor de edad y su grupo familiar. La sopa de pata de res, es un plato típico del país y Edith acostumbra a prepararlo desde hace 15 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia ha logrado posicionarlo en el gusto de sus clientes por su sabor incomparable, además para obtener mejores ingresos económicos realiza la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. La vivienda de Edith cuenta con un corredor, que le permite tener un poco más de espacio en su vivienda, pero está actualmente es de tierra, lo que provoca enfermedades respiratorias a su grupo familiar en época de verano y en invierno la lluvia lo convierte en lodo, por lo que Edith ha decidido encementarlo y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edith is a hardworking woman who is 58 years of age. She lives with her grown daughter and her family. “Sopa de pata” [beef tripe soup] is a traditional dish in El Salvador and Edith has been preparing it for the past 15 years. Thanks to her experience, she has been able to satisfy the tastes of her customers because of the incomparable flavors that she produces. In addition, she generates extra income by selling beauty products through catalogs.

Edith’s house has a corridor that provide a little bit more living space, but it currently has a dirt floor. This can cause respiratory illnesses for her family during the summer and the winter rains turn the floor into mud. For this recent, Edith would like to lay down concrete. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in cement, sand, and gravel in order to install a concrete floor in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel in order to install a concrete floor in her home.

loans.name: Sixta Helena

texts.es:
Sixta, una mujer de 41 años de edad llena de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Carepa y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de cerdos, pollos y huevos.  
Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposo e hijos.

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace algún tiempo con el fin de salir adelante.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Sixta!
texts.en: Sixta is a 41 year old woman, full of dreams and hopes in her life. She lives in a farm in the municipality of Carepa, and she earns her living with the production and sale of pigs, chickens and eggs. With this job she tries to support her family, composed by her husband and children. It is a job she has been doing for some time in order to move ahead. She is requesting financial support to buy chickens, laying hens, food and materials for her barn. With this loan she will be able to have a more sustainable and consolidated business. With a loan that you do today you can improve Sixta's life and business!

loans.use: to buy chickens, laying hens, food and materials for her barn.
